2990 /*
2991  * Go to a window that contains the specified buffer 'qf_fnum'. If a window is
2992  * not found, then go to the window just above the quickfix window. This is
2993  * used for opening a file from a quickfix window and not from a location
2994  * window.
2995  */
2996  static void
2997 qf_goto_win_with_qfl_file(int qf_fnum)
2998 {
2999  win_T *win;
3000  win_T *altwin;
3001 
3002  win = curwin;
3003  altwin = NULL;
3004  for (;;)
3005  {
3006  if (win->w_buffer->b_fnum == qf_fnum)
3007  break;
3008  if (win->w_prev == NULL)
3009  win = lastwin; // wrap around the top
3010  else
3011  win = win->w_prev; // go to previous window
3012 
3013  if (IS_QF_WINDOW(win))
3014  {
3015  // Didn't find it, go to the window before the quickfix
3016  // window.
3017  if (altwin != NULL)
3018  win = altwin;
3019  else if (curwin->w_prev != NULL)
3020  win = curwin->w_prev;
3021  else
3022  win = curwin->w_next;
3023  break;
3024  }
3025 
3026  // Remember a usable window.
3027  if (altwin == NULL && !win->w_p_pvw && bt_normal(win->w_buffer))
3028  altwin = win;
3029  }
3030 
3031  win_goto(win);
3032 }
3033 
3034 /*
3035  * Find a suitable window for opening a file (qf_fnum) from the
3036  * quickfix/location list and jump to it. If the file is already opened in a
3037  * window, jump to it. Otherwise open a new window to display the file. If
3038  * 'newwin' is TRUE, then always open a new window. This is called from either
3039  * a quickfix or a location list window.
3040  */
3041  static int
3042 qf_jump_to_usable_window(int qf_fnum, int newwin, int *opened_window)
3043 {
3044  win_T *usable_win_ptr = NULL;
3045  int usable_win;
3046  qf_info_T *ll_ref = NULL;
3047  win_T *win;
3048 
3049  usable_win = 0;
3050 
3051  // If opening a new window, then don't use the location list referred by
3052  // the current window. Otherwise two windows will refer to the same
3053  // location list.
3054  if (!newwin)
3055  ll_ref = curwin->w_llist_ref;
3056 
3057  if (ll_ref != NULL)
3058  {
3059  // Find a non-quickfix window with this location list
3060  usable_win_ptr = qf_find_win_with_loclist(ll_ref);
3061  if (usable_win_ptr != NULL)
3062  usable_win = 1;
3063  }
3064 
3065  if (!usable_win)
3066  {
3067  // Locate a window showing a normal buffer
3068  win = qf_find_win_with_normal_buf();
3069  if (win != NULL)
3070  usable_win = 1;
3071  }
3072 
3073  // If no usable window is found and 'switchbuf' contains "usetab"
3074  // then search in other tabs.
3075  if (!usable_win && (swb_flags & SWB_USETAB))
3076  usable_win = qf_goto_tabwin_with_file(qf_fnum);
3077 
3078  // If there is only one window and it is the quickfix window, create a
3079  // new one above the quickfix window.
3080  if ((ONE_WINDOW && bt_quickfix(curbuf)) || !usable_win || newwin)
3081  {
3082  if (qf_open_new_file_win(ll_ref) != OK)
3083  return FAIL;
3084  *opened_window = TRUE; // close it when fail
3085  }
3086  else
3087  {
3088  if (curwin->w_llist_ref != NULL) // In a location window
3089  qf_goto_win_with_ll_file(usable_win_ptr, qf_fnum, ll_ref);
3090  else // In a quickfix window
3091  qf_goto_win_with_qfl_file(qf_fnum);
3092  }
3093 
3094  return OK;
3095 }
3096 
3097 /*
3098  * Edit the selected file or help file.
3099  * Returns OK if successfully edited the file, FAIL on failing to open the
3100  * buffer and NOTDONE if the quickfix/location list was freed by an autocmd
3101  * when opening the buffer.
3102  */
3103  static int
3104 qf_jump_edit_buffer(
3105  qf_info_T *qi,
3106  qfline_T *qf_ptr,
3107  int forceit,
3108  int prev_winid,
3109  int *opened_window)
3110 {
3111  qf_list_T *qfl = qf_get_curlist(qi);
3112  qfltype_T qfl_type = qfl->qfl_type;
3113  int retval = OK;
3114  int old_qf_curlist = qi->qf_curlist;
3115  int save_qfid = qfl->qf_id;
3116 
3117  if (qf_ptr->qf_type == 1)
3118  {
3119  // Open help file (do_ecmd() will set b_help flag, readfile() will
3120  // set b_p_ro flag).
3121  if (!can_abandon(curbuf, forceit))
3122  {
3123  no_write_message();
3124  return FAIL;
3125  }
3126 
3127  retval = do_ecmd(qf_ptr->qf_fnum, NULL, NULL, NULL, (linenr_T)1,
3128  ECMD_HIDE + ECMD_SET_HELP,
3129  prev_winid == curwin->w_id ? curwin : NULL);
3130  }
3131  else
3132  retval = buflist_getfile(qf_ptr->qf_fnum,
3133  (linenr_T)1, GETF_SETMARK | GETF_SWITCH, forceit);
3134 
3135  // If a location list, check whether the associated window is still
3136  // present.
3137  if (qfl_type == QFLT_LOCATION)
3138  {
3139  win_T *wp = win_id2wp(prev_winid);
3140  if (wp == NULL && curwin->w_llist != qi)
3141  {
3142  emsg(_("E924: Current window was closed"));
3143  *opened_window = FALSE;
3144  return NOTDONE;
3145  }
3146  }
3147 
3148  if (qfl_type == QFLT_QUICKFIX && !qflist_valid(NULL, save_qfid))
3149  {
3150  emsg(_("E925: Current quickfix was changed"));
3151  return NOTDONE;
3152  }
3153 
3154  if (old_qf_curlist != qi->qf_curlist
3155  || !is_qf_entry_present(qfl, qf_ptr))
3156  {
3157  if (qfl_type == QFLT_QUICKFIX)
3158  emsg(_("E925: Current quickfix was changed"));
3159  else
3160  emsg(_(e_loc_list_changed));
3161  return NOTDONE;
3162  }
3163 
3164  return retval;
3165 }
3166 
3167 /*
3168  * Go to the error line in the current file using either line/column number or
3169  * a search pattern.
3170  */
3171  static void
3172 qf_jump_goto_line(
3173  linenr_T qf_lnum,
3174  int qf_col,
3175  char_u qf_viscol,
3176  char_u *qf_pattern)
3177 {
3178  linenr_T i;
3179 
3180  if (qf_pattern == NULL)
3181  {
3182  // Go to line with error, unless qf_lnum is 0.
3183  i = qf_lnum;
3184  if (i > 0)
3185  {
3186  if (i > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
3187  i = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
3188  curwin->w_cursor.lnum = i;
3189  }
3190  if (qf_col > 0)
3191  {
3192  curwin->w_cursor.coladd = 0;
3193  if (qf_viscol == TRUE)
3194  coladvance(qf_col - 1);
3195  else
3196  curwin->w_cursor.col = qf_col - 1;
3197  curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE;
3198  check_cursor();
3199  }
3200  else
3201  beginline(BL_WHITE | BL_FIX);
3202  }
3203  else
3204  {
3205  pos_T save_cursor;
3206 
3207  // Move the cursor to the first line in the buffer
3208  save_cursor = curwin->w_cursor;
3209  curwin->w_cursor.lnum = 0;
3210  if (!do_search(NULL, '/', qf_pattern, (long)1,
3211  SEARCH_KEEP, NULL, NULL))
3212  curwin->w_cursor = save_cursor;
3213  }
3214 }
3215 
3216 /*
3217  * Display quickfix list index and size message
3218  */
3219  static void
3220 qf_jump_print_msg(
3221  qf_info_T *qi,
3222  int qf_index,
3223  qfline_T *qf_ptr,
3224  buf_T *old_curbuf,
3225  linenr_T old_lnum)
3226 {
3227  linenr_T i;
3228  int len;
3229 
3230  // Update the screen before showing the message, unless the screen
3231  // scrolled up.
3232  if (!msg_scrolled)
3233  update_topline_redraw();
3234  sprintf((char *)IObuff, _("(%d of %d)%s%s: "), qf_index,
3235  qf_get_curlist(qi)->qf_count,
3236  qf_ptr->qf_cleared ? _(" (line deleted)") : "",
3237  (char *)qf_types(qf_ptr->qf_type, qf_ptr->qf_nr));
3238  // Add the message, skipping leading whitespace and newlines.
3239  len = (int)STRLEN(IObuff);
3240  qf_fmt_text(skipwhite(qf_ptr->qf_text), IObuff + len, IOSIZE - len);
3241 
3242  // Output the message. Overwrite to avoid scrolling when the 'O'
3243  // flag is present in 'shortmess'; But when not jumping, print the
3244  // whole message.
3245  i = msg_scroll;
3246  if (curbuf == old_curbuf && curwin->w_cursor.lnum == old_lnum)
3247  msg_scroll = TRUE;
3248  else if (!msg_scrolled && shortmess(SHM_OVERALL))
3249  msg_scroll = FALSE;
3250  msg_attr_keep((char *)IObuff, 0, TRUE);
3251  msg_scroll = i;
3252 }
3253 
3254 /*
3255  * Find a usable window for opening a file from the quickfix/location list. If
3256  * a window is not found then open a new window. If 'newwin' is TRUE, then open
3257  * a new window.
3258  * Returns OK if successfully jumped or opened a window. Returns FAIL if not
3259  * able to jump/open a window. Returns NOTDONE if a file is not associated
3260  * with the entry.
3261  */
3262  static int
3263 qf_jump_open_window(
3264  qf_info_T *qi,
3265  qfline_T *qf_ptr,
3266  int newwin,
3267  int *opened_window)
3268 {
3269  // For ":helpgrep" find a help window or open one.
3270  if (qf_ptr->qf_type == 1 && (!bt_help(curwin->w_buffer) || cmdmod.tab != 0))
3271  if (jump_to_help_window(qi, newwin, opened_window) == FAIL)
3272  return FAIL;
3273 
3274  // If currently in the quickfix window, find another window to show the
3275  // file in.
3276  if (bt_quickfix(curbuf) && !*opened_window)
3277  {
3278  // If there is no file specified, we don't know where to go.
3279  // But do advance, otherwise ":cn" gets stuck.
3280  if (qf_ptr->qf_fnum == 0)
3281  return NOTDONE;
3282 
3283  if (qf_jump_to_usable_window(qf_ptr->qf_fnum, newwin,
3284  opened_window) == FAIL)
3285  return FAIL;
3286  }
3287 
3288  return OK;
3289 }
3290 
3291 /*
3292  * Edit a selected file from the quickfix/location list and jump to a
3293  * particular line/column, adjust the folds and display a message about the
3294  * jump.
3295  * Returns OK on success and FAIL on failing to open the file/buffer. Returns
3296  * NOTDONE if the quickfix/location list is freed by an autocmd when opening
3297  * the file.
3298  */
3299  static int
3300 qf_jump_to_buffer(
3301  qf_info_T *qi,
3302  int qf_index,
3303  qfline_T *qf_ptr,
3304  int forceit,
3305  int prev_winid,
3306  int *opened_window,
3307  int openfold,
3308  int print_message)
3309 {
3310  buf_T *old_curbuf;
3311  linenr_T old_lnum;
3312  int retval = OK;
3313 
3314  // If there is a file name, read the wanted file if needed, and check
3315  // autowrite etc.
3316  old_curbuf = curbuf;
3317  old_lnum = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
3318 
3319  if (qf_ptr->qf_fnum != 0)
3320  {
3321  retval = qf_jump_edit_buffer(qi, qf_ptr, forceit, prev_winid,
3322  opened_window);
3323  if (retval != OK)
3324  return retval;
3325  }
3326 
3327  // When not switched to another buffer, still need to set pc mark
3328  if (curbuf == old_curbuf)
3329  setpcmark();
3330 
3331  qf_jump_goto_line(qf_ptr->qf_lnum, qf_ptr->qf_col, qf_ptr->qf_viscol,
3332  qf_ptr->qf_pattern);
3333 
3334 #ifdef FEAT_FOLDING
3335  if ((fdo_flags & FDO_QUICKFIX) && openfold)
3336  foldOpenCursor();
3337 #endif
3338  if (print_message)
3339  qf_jump_print_msg(qi, qf_index, qf_ptr, old_curbuf, old_lnum);
3340 
3341  return retval;
3342 }
3343 
3344 /*
3345  * Jump to a quickfix line and try to use an existing window.
3346  */
3347  void
3348 qf_jump(qf_info_T *qi,
3349  int dir,
3350  int errornr,
3351  int forceit)
3352 {
3353  qf_jump_newwin(qi, dir, errornr, forceit, FALSE);
3354 }
3355 
3356 /*
3357  * Jump to a quickfix line.
3358  * If dir == 0 go to entry "errornr".
3359  * If dir == FORWARD go "errornr" valid entries forward.
3360  * If dir == BACKWARD go "errornr" valid entries backward.
3361  * If dir == FORWARD_FILE go "errornr" valid entries files backward.
3362  * If dir == BACKWARD_FILE go "errornr" valid entries files backward
3363  * else if "errornr" is zero, redisplay the same line
3364  * If 'forceit' is TRUE, then can discard changes to the current buffer.
3365  * If 'newwin' is TRUE, then open the file in a new window.
3366  */
3367  static void
3368 qf_jump_newwin(qf_info_T *qi,
3369  int dir,
3370  int errornr,
3371  int forceit,
3372  int newwin)
3373 {
3374  qf_list_T *qfl;
3375  qfline_T *qf_ptr;
3376  qfline_T *old_qf_ptr;
3377  int qf_index;
3378  int old_qf_index;
3379  char_u *old_swb = p_swb;
3380  unsigned old_swb_flags = swb_flags;
3381  int prev_winid;
3382  int opened_window = FALSE;
3383  int print_message = TRUE;
3384  int old_KeyTyped = KeyTyped; // getting file may reset it
3385  int retval = OK;
3386 
3387  if (qi == NULL)
3388  qi = &ql_info;
3389 
3390  if (qf_stack_empty(qi) || qf_list_empty(qf_get_curlist(qi)))
3391  {
3392  emsg(_(e_quickfix));
3393  return;
3394  }
3395 
3396  incr_quickfix_busy();
3397 
3398  qfl = qf_get_curlist(qi);
3399 
3400  qf_ptr = qfl->qf_ptr;
3401  old_qf_ptr = qf_ptr;
3402  qf_index = qfl->qf_index;
3403  old_qf_index = qf_index;
3404 
3405  qf_ptr = qf_get_entry(qfl, errornr, dir, &qf_index);
3406  if (qf_ptr == NULL)
3407  {
3408  qf_ptr = old_qf_ptr;
3409  qf_index = old_qf_index;
3410  goto theend;
3411  }
3412 
3413  qfl->qf_index = qf_index;
3414  if (qf_win_pos_update(qi, old_qf_index))
3415  // No need to print the error message if it's visible in the error
3416  // window
3417  print_message = FALSE;
3418 
3419  prev_winid = curwin->w_id;
3420 
3421  retval = qf_jump_open_window(qi, qf_ptr, newwin, &opened_window);
3422  if (retval == FAIL)
3423  goto failed;
3424  if (retval == NOTDONE)
3425  goto theend;
3426 
3427  retval = qf_jump_to_buffer(qi, qf_index, qf_ptr, forceit, prev_winid,
3428  &opened_window, old_KeyTyped, print_message);
3429  if (retval == NOTDONE)
3430  {
3431  // Quickfix/location list is freed by an autocmd
3432  qi = NULL;
3433  qf_ptr = NULL;
3434  }
3435 
3436  if (retval != OK)
3437  {
3438  if (opened_window)
3439  win_close(curwin, TRUE); // Close opened window
3440  if (qf_ptr != NULL && qf_ptr->qf_fnum != 0)
3441  {
3442  // Couldn't open file, so put index back where it was. This could
3443  // happen if the file was readonly and we changed something.
3444 failed:
3445  qf_ptr = old_qf_ptr;
3446  qf_index = old_qf_index;
3447  }
3448  }
3449 theend:
3450  if (qi != NULL)
3451  {
3452  qfl->qf_ptr = qf_ptr;
3453  qfl->qf_index = qf_index;
3454  }
3455  if (p_swb != old_swb)
3456  {
3457  // Restore old 'switchbuf' value, but not when an autocommand or
3458  // modeline has changed the value.
3459  if (p_swb == empty_option)
3460  {
3461  p_swb = old_swb;
3462  swb_flags = old_swb_flags;
3463  }
3464  else
3465  free_string_option(old_swb);
3466  }
3467  decr_quickfix_busy();
3468 }
3469 
3470 // Highlight attributes used for displaying entries from the quickfix list.
3471 static int qfFileAttr;
3472 static int qfSepAttr;
3473 static int qfLineAttr;
3474 
3475 /*
3476  * Display information about a single entry from the quickfix/location list.
3477  * Used by ":clist/:llist" commands.
3478  * 'cursel' will be set to TRUE for the currently selected entry in the
3479  * quickfix list.
3480  */
3481  static void
3482 qf_list_entry(qfline_T *qfp, int qf_idx, int cursel)
3483 {
3484  char_u *fname;
3485  buf_T *buf;
3486  int filter_entry;
3487 
3488  fname = NULL;
3489  if (qfp->qf_module != NULL && *qfp->qf_module != NUL)
3490  vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE, "%2d %s", qf_idx,
3491  (char *)qfp->qf_module);
3492  else {
3493  if (qfp->qf_fnum != 0
3494  && (buf = buflist_findnr(qfp->qf_fnum)) != NULL)
3495  {
3496  fname = buf->b_fname;
3497  if (qfp->qf_type == 1) // :helpgrep
3498  fname = gettail(fname);
3499  }
3500  if (fname == NULL)
3501  sprintf((char *)IObuff, "%2d", qf_idx);
3502  else
3503  vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE, "%2d %s",
3504  qf_idx, (char *)fname);
3505  }
3506 
3507  // Support for filtering entries using :filter /pat/ clist
3508  // Match against the module name, file name, search pattern and
3509  // text of the entry.
3510  filter_entry = TRUE;
3511  if (qfp->qf_module != NULL && *qfp->qf_module != NUL)
3512  filter_entry &= message_filtered(qfp->qf_module);
3513  if (filter_entry && fname != NULL)
3514  filter_entry &= message_filtered(fname);
3515  if (filter_entry && qfp->qf_pattern != NULL)
3516  filter_entry &= message_filtered(qfp->qf_pattern);
3517  if (filter_entry)
3518  filter_entry &= message_filtered(qfp->qf_text);
3519  if (filter_entry)
3520  return;
3521 
3522  msg_putchar('\n');
3523  msg_outtrans_attr(IObuff, cursel ? HL_ATTR(HLF_QFL) : qfFileAttr);
3524 
3525  if (qfp->qf_lnum != 0)
3526  msg_puts_attr(":", qfSepAttr);
3527  if (qfp->qf_lnum == 0)
3528  IObuff[0] = NUL;
3529  else if (qfp->qf_col == 0)
3530  sprintf((char *)IObuff, "%ld", qfp->qf_lnum);
3531  else
3532  sprintf((char *)IObuff, "%ld col %d",
3533  qfp->qf_lnum, qfp->qf_col);
3534  sprintf((char *)IObuff + STRLEN(IObuff), "%s",
3535  (char *)qf_types(qfp->qf_type, qfp->qf_nr));
3536  msg_puts_attr((char *)IObuff, qfLineAttr);
3537  msg_puts_attr(":", qfSepAttr);
3538  if (qfp->qf_pattern != NULL)
3539  {
3540  qf_fmt_text(qfp->qf_pattern, IObuff, IOSIZE);
3541  msg_puts((char *)IObuff);
3542  msg_puts_attr(":", qfSepAttr);
3543  }
3544  msg_puts(" ");
3545 
3546  // Remove newlines and leading whitespace from the text. For an
3547  // unrecognized line keep the indent, the compiler may mark a word
3548  // with ^^^^.
3549  qf_fmt_text((fname != NULL || qfp->qf_lnum != 0)
3550  ? skipwhite(qfp->qf_text) : qfp->qf_text,
3551  IObuff, IOSIZE);
3552  msg_prt_line(IObuff, FALSE);
3553  out_flush(); // show one line at a time
3554 }
3555 
3556 /*
3557  * ":clist": list all errors
3558  * ":llist": list all locations
3559  */
3560  void
3561 qf_list(exarg_T *eap)
3562 {
3563  qf_list_T *qfl;
3564  qfline_T *qfp;
3565  int i;
3566  int idx1 = 1;
3567  int idx2 = -1;
3568  char_u *arg = eap->arg;
3569  int plus = FALSE;
3570  int all = eap->forceit; // if not :cl!, only show
3571  // recognised errors
3572  qf_info_T *qi;
3573 
3574  if ((qi = qf_cmd_get_stack(eap, TRUE)) == NULL)
3575  return;
3576 
3577  if (qf_stack_empty(qi) || qf_list_empty(qf_get_curlist(qi)))
3578  {
3579  emsg(_(e_quickfix));
3580  return;
3581  }
3582  if (*arg == '+')
3583  {
3584  ++arg;
3585  plus = TRUE;
3586  }
3587  if (!get_list_range(&arg, &idx1, &idx2) || *arg != NUL)
3588  {
3589  emsg(_(e_trailing));
3590  return;
3591  }
3592  qfl = qf_get_curlist(qi);
3593  if (plus)
3594  {
3595  i = qfl->qf_index;
3596  idx2 = i + idx1;
3597  idx1 = i;
3598  }
3599  else
3600  {
3601  i = qfl->qf_count;
3602  if (idx1 < 0)
3603  idx1 = (-idx1 > i) ? 0 : idx1 + i + 1;
3604  if (idx2 < 0)
3605  idx2 = (-idx2 > i) ? 0 : idx2 + i + 1;
3606  }
3607 
3608  // Shorten all the file names, so that it is easy to read
3609  shorten_fnames(FALSE);
3610 
3611  // Get the attributes for the different quickfix highlight items. Note
3612  // that this depends on syntax items defined in the qf.vim syntax file
3613  qfFileAttr = syn_name2attr((char_u *)"qfFileName");
3614  if (qfFileAttr == 0)
3615  qfFileAttr = HL_ATTR(HLF_D);
3616  qfSepAttr = syn_name2attr((char_u *)"qfSeparator");
3617  if (qfSepAttr == 0)
3618  qfSepAttr = HL_ATTR(HLF_D);
3619  qfLineAttr = syn_name2attr((char_u *)"qfLineNr");
3620  if (qfLineAttr == 0)
3621  qfLineAttr = HL_ATTR(HLF_N);
3622 
3623  if (qfl->qf_nonevalid)
3624  all = TRUE;
3625  FOR_ALL_QFL_ITEMS(qfl, qfp, i)
3626  {
3627  if ((qfp->qf_valid || all) && idx1 <= i && i <= idx2)
3628  qf_list_entry(qfp, i, i == qfl->qf_index);
3629 
3630  ui_breakcheck();
3631  }
3632 }
3633 
3634 /*
3635  * Remove newlines and leading whitespace from an error message.
3636  * Put the result in "buf[bufsize]".
3637  */
3638  static void
3639 qf_fmt_text(char_u *text, char_u *buf, int bufsize)
3640 {
3641  int i;
3642  char_u *p = text;
3643 
3644  for (i = 0; *p != NUL && i < bufsize - 1; ++i)
3645  {
3646  if (*p == '\n')
3647  {
3648  buf[i] = ' ';
3649  while (*++p != NUL)
3650  if (!VIM_ISWHITE(*p) && *p != '\n')
3651  break;
3652  }
3653  else
3654  buf[i] = *p++;
3655  }
3656  buf[i] = NUL;
3657 }
3658 
3659 /*
3660  * Display information (list number, list size and the title) about a
3661  * quickfix/location list.
3662  */
3663  static void
3664 qf_msg(qf_info_T *qi, int which, char *lead)
3665 {
3666  char *title = (char *)qi->qf_lists[which].qf_title;
3667  int count = qi->qf_lists[which].qf_count;
3668  char_u buf[IOSIZE];
3669 
3670  vim_snprintf((char *)buf, IOSIZE, _("%serror list %d of %d; %d errors "),
3671  lead,
3672  which + 1,
3673  qi->qf_listcount,
3674  count);
3675 
3676  if (title != NULL)
3677  {
3678  size_t len = STRLEN(buf);
3679 
3680  if (len < 34)
3681  {
3682  vim_memset(buf + len, ' ', 34 - len);
3683  buf[34] = NUL;
3684  }
3685  vim_strcat(buf, (char_u *)title, IOSIZE);
3686  }
3687  trunc_string(buf, buf, Columns - 1, IOSIZE);
3688  msg((char *)buf);
3689 }
3690 
3691 /*
3692  * ":colder [count]": Up in the quickfix stack.
3693  * ":cnewer [count]": Down in the quickfix stack.
3694  * ":lolder [count]": Up in the location list stack.
3695  * ":lnewer [count]": Down in the location list stack.
3696  */
3697  void
3698 qf_age(exarg_T *eap)
3699 {
3700  qf_info_T *qi;
3701  int count;
3702 
3703  if ((qi = qf_cmd_get_stack(eap, TRUE)) == NULL)
3704  return;
3705 
3706  if (eap->addr_count != 0)
3707  count = eap->line2;
3708  else
3709  count = 1;
3710  while (count--)
3711  {
3712  if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_colder || eap->cmdidx == CMD_lolder)
3713  {
3714  if (qi->qf_curlist == 0)
3715  {
3716  emsg(_("E380: At bottom of quickfix stack"));
3717  break;
3718  }
3719  --qi->qf_curlist;
3720  }
3721  else
3722  {
3723  if (qi->qf_curlist >= qi->qf_listcount - 1)
3724  {
3725  emsg(_("E381: At top of quickfix stack"));
3726  break;
3727  }
3728  ++qi->qf_curlist;
3729  }
3730  }
3731  qf_msg(qi, qi->qf_curlist, "");
3732  qf_update_buffer(qi, NULL);
3733 }
3734 
3735 /*
3736  * Display the information about all the quickfix/location lists in the stack
3737  */
3738  void
3739 qf_history(exarg_T *eap)
3740 {
3741  qf_info_T *qi = qf_cmd_get_stack(eap, FALSE);
3742  int i;
3743 
3744  if (eap->addr_count > 0)
3745  {
3746  if (qi == NULL)
3747  {
3748  emsg(_(e_loclist));
3749  return;
3750  }
3751 
3752  // Jump to the specified quickfix list
3753  if (eap->line2 > 0 && eap->line2 <= qi->qf_listcount)
3754  {
3755  qi->qf_curlist = eap->line2 - 1;
3756  qf_msg(qi, qi->qf_curlist, "");
3757  qf_update_buffer(qi, NULL);
3758  }
3759  else
3760  emsg(_(e_invrange));
3761 
3762  return;
3763  }
3764 
3765  if (qf_stack_empty(qi))
3766  msg(_("No entries"));
3767  else
3768  for (i = 0; i < qi->qf_listcount; ++i)
3769  qf_msg(qi, i, i == qi->qf_curlist ? "> " : " ");
3770 }
3771 
3772 /*
3773  * Free all the entries in the error list "idx". Note that other information
3774  * associated with the list like context and title are not freed.
3775  */
3776  static void
3777 qf_free_items(qf_list_T *qfl)
3778 {
3779  qfline_T *qfp;
3780  qfline_T *qfpnext;
3781  int stop = FALSE;
3782 
3783  while (qfl->qf_count && qfl->qf_start != NULL)
3784  {
3785  qfp = qfl->qf_start;
3786  qfpnext = qfp->qf_next;
3787  if (!stop)
3788  {
3789  vim_free(qfp->qf_module);
3790  vim_free(qfp->qf_text);
3791  vim_free(qfp->qf_pattern);
3792  stop = (qfp == qfpnext);
3793  vim_free(qfp);
3794  if (stop)
3795  // Somehow qf_count may have an incorrect value, set it to 1
3796  // to avoid crashing when it's wrong.
3797  // TODO: Avoid qf_count being incorrect.
3798  qfl->qf_count = 1;
3799  }
3800  qfl->qf_start = qfpnext;
3801  --qfl->qf_count;
3802  }
3803 
3804  qfl->qf_index = 0;
3805  qfl->qf_start = NULL;
3806  qfl->qf_last = NULL;
3807  qfl->qf_ptr = NULL;
3808  qfl->qf_nonevalid = TRUE;
3809 
3810  qf_clean_dir_stack(&qfl->qf_dir_stack);
3811  qfl->qf_directory = NULL;
3812  qf_clean_dir_stack(&qfl->qf_file_stack);
3813  qfl->qf_currfile = NULL;
3814  qfl->qf_multiline = FALSE;
3815  qfl->qf_multiignore = FALSE;
3816  qfl->qf_multiscan = FALSE;
3817 }
3818 
3819 /*
3820  * Free error list "idx". Frees all the entries in the quickfix list,
3821  * associated context information and the title.
3822  */
3823  static void
3824 qf_free(qf_list_T *qfl)
3825 {
3826  qf_free_items(qfl);
3827 
3828  VIM_CLEAR(qfl->qf_title);
3829  free_tv(qfl->qf_ctx);
3830  qfl->qf_ctx = NULL;
3831  qfl->qf_id = 0;
3832  qfl->qf_changedtick = 0L;
3833 }
3834 
3835 /*
3836  * qf_mark_adjust: adjust marks
3837  */
3838  void
3839 qf_mark_adjust(
3840  win_T *wp,
3841  linenr_T line1,
3842  linenr_T line2,
3843  long amount,
3844  long amount_after)
3845 {
3846  int i;
3847  qfline_T *qfp;
3848  int idx;
3849  qf_info_T *qi = &ql_info;
3850  int found_one = FALSE;
3851  int buf_has_flag = wp == NULL ? BUF_HAS_QF_ENTRY : BUF_HAS_LL_ENTRY;
3852 
3853  if (!(curbuf->b_has_qf_entry & buf_has_flag))
3854  return;
3855  if (wp != NULL)
3856  {
3857  if (wp->w_llist == NULL)
3858  return;
3859  qi = wp->w_llist;
3860  }
3861 
3862  for (idx = 0; idx < qi->qf_listcount; ++idx)
3863  {
3864  qf_list_T *qfl = qf_get_list(qi, idx);
3865 
3866  if (!qf_list_empty(qfl))
3867  FOR_ALL_QFL_ITEMS(qfl, qfp, i)
3868  if (qfp->qf_fnum == curbuf->b_fnum)
3869  {
3870  found_one = TRUE;
3871  if (qfp->qf_lnum >= line1 && qfp->qf_lnum <= line2)
3872  {
3873  if (amount == MAXLNUM)
3874  qfp->qf_cleared = TRUE;
3875  else
3876  qfp->qf_lnum += amount;
3877  }
3878  else if (amount_after && qfp->qf_lnum > line2)
3879  qfp->qf_lnum += amount_after;
3880  }
3881  }
3882 
3883  if (!found_one)
3884  curbuf->b_has_qf_entry &= ~buf_has_flag;
3885 }
3886 
3887 /*
3888  * Make a nice message out of the error character and the error number:
3889  * char number message
3890  * e or E 0 " error"
3891  * w or W 0 " warning"
3892  * i or I 0 " info"
3893  * 0 0 ""
3894  * other 0 " c"
3895  * e or E n " error n"
3896  * w or W n " warning n"
3897  * i or I n " info n"
3898  * 0 n " error n"
3899  * other n " c n"
3900  * 1 x "" :helpgrep
3901  */
3902  static char_u *
3903 qf_types(int c, int nr)
3904 {
3905  static char_u buf[20];
3906  static char_u cc[3];
3907  char_u *p;
3908 
3909  if (c == 'W' || c == 'w')
3910  p = (char_u *)" warning";
3911  else if (c == 'I' || c == 'i')
3912  p = (char_u *)" info";
3913  else if (c == 'E' || c == 'e' || (c == 0 && nr > 0))
3914  p = (char_u *)" error";
3915  else if (c == 0 || c == 1)
3916  p = (char_u *)"";
3917  else
3918  {
3919  cc[0] = ' ';
3920  cc[1] = c;
3921  cc[2] = NUL;
3922  p = cc;
3923  }
3924 
3925  if (nr <= 0)
3926  return p;
3927 
3928  sprintf((char *)buf, "%s %3d", (char *)p, nr);
3929  return buf;
3930 }
3931 
3932 /*
3933  * When "split" is FALSE: Open the entry/result under the cursor.
3934  * When "split" is TRUE: Open the entry/result under the cursor in a new window.
3935  */
3936  void
3937 qf_view_result(int split)
3938 {
3939  qf_info_T *qi = &ql_info;
3940 
3941  if (!bt_quickfix(curbuf))
3942  return;
3943 
3944  if (IS_LL_WINDOW(curwin))
3945  qi = GET_LOC_LIST(curwin);
3946 
3947  if (qf_list_empty(qf_get_curlist(qi)))
3948  {
3949  emsg(_(e_quickfix));
3950  return;
3951  }
3952 
3953  if (split)
3954  {
3955  // Open the selected entry in a new window
3956  qf_jump_newwin(qi, 0, (long)curwin->w_cursor.lnum, FALSE, TRUE);
3957  do_cmdline_cmd((char_u *) "clearjumps");
3958  return;
3959  }
3960 
3961  do_cmdline_cmd((char_u *)(IS_LL_WINDOW(curwin) ? ".ll" : ".cc"));
3962 }
3963 
3964 /*
3965  * ":cwindow": open the quickfix window if we have errors to display,
3966  * close it if not.
3967  * ":lwindow": open the location list window if we have locations to display,
3968  * close it if not.
3969  */
3970  void
3971 ex_cwindow(exarg_T *eap)
3972 {
3973  qf_info_T *qi;
3974  qf_list_T *qfl;
3975  win_T *win;
3976 
3977  if ((qi = qf_cmd_get_stack(eap, TRUE)) == NULL)
3978  return;
3979 
3980  qfl = qf_get_curlist(qi);
3981 
3982  // Look for an existing quickfix window.
3983  win = qf_find_win(qi);
3984 
3985  // If a quickfix window is open but we have no errors to display,
3986  // close the window. If a quickfix window is not open, then open
3987  // it if we have errors; otherwise, leave it closed.
3988  if (qf_stack_empty(qi)
3989  || qfl->qf_nonevalid
3990  || qf_list_empty(qfl))
3991  {
3992  if (win != NULL)
3993  ex_cclose(eap);
3994  }
3995  else if (win == NULL)
3996  ex_copen(eap);
3997 }
3998 
3999 /*
4000  * ":cclose": close the window showing the list of errors.
4001  * ":lclose": close the window showing the location list
4002  */
4003  void
4004 ex_cclose(exarg_T *eap)
4005 {
4006  win_T *win = NULL;
4007  qf_info_T *qi;
4008 
4009  if ((qi = qf_cmd_get_stack(eap, FALSE)) == NULL)
4010  return;
4011 
4012  // Find existing quickfix window and close it.
4013  win = qf_find_win(qi);
4014  if (win != NULL)
4015  win_close(win, FALSE);
4016 }
4017 
4018 /*
4019  * Set "w:quickfix_title" if "qi" has a title.
4020  */
4021  static void
4022 qf_set_title_var(qf_list_T *qfl)
4023 {
4024  if (qfl->qf_title != NULL)
4025  set_internal_string_var((char_u *)"w:quickfix_title", qfl->qf_title);
4026 }
4027 
4028 /*
4029  * Goto a quickfix or location list window (if present).
4030  * Returns OK if the window is found, FAIL otherwise.
4031  */
4032  static int
4033 qf_goto_cwindow(qf_info_T *qi, int resize, int sz, int vertsplit)
4034 {
4035  win_T *win;
4036 
4037  win = qf_find_win(qi);
4038  if (win == NULL)
4039  return FAIL;
4040 
4041  win_goto(win);
4042  if (resize)
4043  {
4044  if (vertsplit)
4045  {
4046  if (sz != win->w_width)
4047  win_setwidth(sz);
4048  }
4049  else if (sz != win->w_height
4050  && win->w_height + win->w_status_height < cmdline_row)
4051  win_setheight(sz);
4052  }
4053 
4054  return OK;
4055 }
4056 
4057 /*
4058  * Set options for the buffer in the quickfix or location list window.
4059  */
4060  static void
4061 qf_set_cwindow_options(void)
4062 {
4063  // switch off 'swapfile'
4064  set_option_value((char_u *)"swf", 0L, NULL, OPT_LOCAL);
4065  set_option_value((char_u *)"bt", 0L, (char_u *)"quickfix",
4066  OPT_LOCAL);
4067  set_option_value((char_u *)"bh", 0L, (char_u *)"hide", OPT_LOCAL);
4068  RESET_BINDING(curwin);
4069 #ifdef FEAT_DIFF
4070  curwin->w_p_diff = FALSE;
4071 #endif
4072 #ifdef FEAT_FOLDING
4073  set_option_value((char_u *)"fdm", 0L, (char_u *)"manual",
4074  OPT_LOCAL);
4075 #endif
4076 }
4077 
4078 /*
4079  * Open a new quickfix or location list window, load the quickfix buffer and
4080  * set the appropriate options for the window.
4081  * Returns FAIL if the window could not be opened.
4082  */
4083  static int
4084 qf_open_new_cwindow(qf_info_T *qi, int height)
4085 {
4086  buf_T *qf_buf;
4087  win_T *oldwin = curwin;
4088  tabpage_T *prevtab = curtab;
4089  int flags = 0;
4090  win_T *win;
4091 
4092  qf_buf = qf_find_buf(qi);
4093 
4094  // The current window becomes the previous window afterwards.
4095  win = curwin;
4096 
4097  if (IS_QF_STACK(qi) && cmdmod.split == 0)
4098  // Create the new quickfix window at the very bottom, except when
4099  // :belowright or :aboveleft is used.
4100  win_goto(lastwin);
4101  // Default is to open the window below the current window
4102  if (cmdmod.split == 0)
4103  flags = WSP_BELOW;
4104  flags |= WSP_NEWLOC;
4105  if (win_split(height, flags) == FAIL)
4106  return FAIL; // not enough room for window
4107  RESET_BINDING(curwin);
4108 
4109  if (IS_LL_STACK(qi))
4110  {
4111  // For the location list window, create a reference to the
4112  // location list stack from the window 'win'.
4113  curwin->w_llist_ref = qi;
4114  qi->qf_refcount++;
4115  }
4116 
4117  if (oldwin != curwin)
4118  oldwin = NULL; // don't store info when in another window
4119  if (qf_buf != NULL)
4120  {
4121  // Use the existing quickfix buffer
4122  (void)do_ecmd(qf_buf->b_fnum, NULL, NULL, NULL, ECMD_ONE,
4123  ECMD_HIDE + ECMD_OLDBUF, oldwin);
4124  }
4125  else
4126  {
4127  // Create a new quickfix buffer
4128  (void)do_ecmd(0, NULL, NULL, NULL, ECMD_ONE, ECMD_HIDE, oldwin);
4129 
4130  // save the number of the new buffer
4131  qi->qf_bufnr = curbuf->b_fnum;
4132  }
4133 
4134  // Set the options for the quickfix buffer/window (if not already done)
4135  // Do this even if the quickfix buffer was already present, as an autocmd
4136  // might have previously deleted (:bdelete) the quickfix buffer.
4137  if (!bt_quickfix(curbuf))
4138  qf_set_cwindow_options();
4139 
4140  // Only set the height when still in the same tab page and there is no
4141  // window to the side.
4142  if (curtab == prevtab && curwin->w_width == Columns)
4143  win_setheight(height);
4144  curwin->w_p_wfh = TRUE; // set 'winfixheight'
4145  if (win_valid(win))
4146  prevwin = win;
4147 
4148  return OK;
4149 }
4150 
4151 /*
4152  * ":copen": open a window that shows the list of errors.
4153  * ":lopen": open a window that shows the location list.
4154  */
4155  void
4156 ex_copen(exarg_T *eap)
4157 {
4158  qf_info_T *qi;
4159  qf_list_T *qfl;
4160  int height;
4161  int status = FAIL;
4162  int lnum;
4163 
4164  if ((qi = qf_cmd_get_stack(eap, TRUE)) == NULL)
4165  return;
4166 
4167  incr_quickfix_busy();
4168 
4169  if (eap->addr_count != 0)
4170  height = eap->line2;
4171  else
4172  height = QF_WINHEIGHT;
4173 
4174  reset_VIsual_and_resel(); // stop Visual mode
4175 #ifdef FEAT_GUI
4176  need_mouse_correct = TRUE;
4177 #endif
4178 
4179  // Find an existing quickfix window, or open a new one.
4180  if (cmdmod.tab == 0)
4181  status = qf_goto_cwindow(qi, eap->addr_count != 0, height,
4182  cmdmod.split & WSP_VERT);
4183  if (status == FAIL)
4184  if (qf_open_new_cwindow(qi, height) == FAIL)
4185  {
4186  decr_quickfix_busy();
4187  return;
4188  }
4189 
4190  qfl = qf_get_curlist(qi);
4191  qf_set_title_var(qfl);
4192  // Save the current index here, as updating the quickfix buffer may free
4193  // the quickfix list
4194  lnum = qfl->qf_index;
4195 
4196  // Fill the buffer with the quickfix list.
4197  qf_fill_buffer(qfl, curbuf, NULL);
4198 
4199  decr_quickfix_busy();
4200 
4201  curwin->w_cursor.lnum = lnum;
4202  curwin->w_cursor.col = 0;
4203  check_cursor();
4204  update_topline(); // scroll to show the line
4205 }
4206 
4207 /*
4208  * Move the cursor in the quickfix window to "lnum".
4209  */
4210  static void
4211 qf_win_goto(win_T *win, linenr_T lnum)
4212 {
4213  win_T *old_curwin = curwin;
4214 
4215  curwin = win;
4216  curbuf = win->w_buffer;
4217  curwin->w_cursor.lnum = lnum;
4218  curwin->w_cursor.col = 0;
4219  curwin->w_cursor.coladd = 0;
4220  curwin->w_curswant = 0;
4221  update_topline(); // scroll to show the line
4222  redraw_later(VALID);
4223  curwin->w_redr_status = TRUE; // update ruler
4224  curwin = old_curwin;
4225  curbuf = curwin->w_buffer;
4226 }
4227 
4228 /*
4229  * :cbottom/:lbottom commands.
4230  */
4231  void
4232 ex_cbottom(exarg_T *eap)
4233 {
4234  qf_info_T *qi;
4235  win_T *win;
4236 
4237  if ((qi = qf_cmd_get_stack(eap, TRUE)) == NULL)
4238  return;
4239 
4240  win = qf_find_win(qi);
4241  if (win != NULL && win->w_cursor.lnum != win->w_buffer->b_ml.ml_line_count)
4242  qf_win_goto(win, win->w_buffer->b_ml.ml_line_count);
4243 }
4244 
4245 /*
4246  * Return the number of the current entry (line number in the quickfix
4247  * window).
4248  */
4249  linenr_T
4250 qf_current_entry(win_T *wp)
4251 {
4252  qf_info_T *qi = &ql_info;
4253 
4254  if (IS_LL_WINDOW(wp))
4255  // In the location list window, use the referenced location list
4256  qi = wp->w_llist_ref;
4257 
4258  return qf_get_curlist(qi)->qf_index;
4259 }
4260 
4261 /*
4262  * Update the cursor position in the quickfix window to the current error.
4263  * Return TRUE if there is a quickfix window.
4264  */
4265  static int
4266 qf_win_pos_update(
4267  qf_info_T *qi,
4268  int old_qf_index) // previous qf_index or zero
4269 {
4270  win_T *win;
4271  int qf_index = qf_get_curlist(qi)->qf_index;
4272 
4273  // Put the cursor on the current error in the quickfix window, so that
4274  // it's viewable.
4275  win = qf_find_win(qi);
4276  if (win != NULL
4277  && qf_index <= win->w_buffer->b_ml.ml_line_count
4278  && old_qf_index != qf_index)
4279  {
4280  if (qf_index > old_qf_index)
4281  {
4282  win->w_redraw_top = old_qf_index;
4283  win->w_redraw_bot = qf_index;
4284  }
4285  else
4286  {
4287  win->w_redraw_top = qf_index;
4288  win->w_redraw_bot = old_qf_index;
4289  }
4290  qf_win_goto(win, qf_index);
4291  }
4292  return win != NULL;
4293 }
4294 
4295 /*
4296  * Check whether the given window is displaying the specified quickfix/location
4297  * stack.
4298  */
4299  static int
4300 is_qf_win(win_T *win, qf_info_T *qi)
4301 {
4302  // A window displaying the quickfix buffer will have the w_llist_ref field
4303  // set to NULL.
4304  // A window displaying a location list buffer will have the w_llist_ref
4305  // pointing to the location list.
4306  if (bt_quickfix(win->w_buffer))
4307  if ((IS_QF_STACK(qi) && win->w_llist_ref == NULL)
4308  || (IS_LL_STACK(qi) && win->w_llist_ref == qi))
4309  return TRUE;
4310 
4311  return FALSE;
4312 }
4313 
4314 /*
4315  * Find a window displaying the quickfix/location stack 'qi'
4316  * Only searches in the current tabpage.
4317  */
4318  static win_T *
4319 qf_find_win(qf_info_T *qi)
4320 {
4321  win_T *win;
4322 
4323  FOR_ALL_WINDOWS(win)
4324  if (is_qf_win(win, qi))
4325  return win;
4326  return NULL;
4327 }
4328 
4329 /*
4330  * Find a quickfix buffer.
4331  * Searches in windows opened in all the tabs.
4332  */
4333  static buf_T *
4334 qf_find_buf(qf_info_T *qi)
4335 {
4336  tabpage_T *tp;
4337  win_T *win;
4338 
4339  if (qi->qf_bufnr != INVALID_QFBUFNR)
4340  {
4341  buf_T *qfbuf;
4342  qfbuf = buflist_findnr(qi->qf_bufnr);
4343  if (qfbuf != NULL)
4344  return qfbuf;
4345  // buffer is no longer present
4346  qi->qf_bufnr = INVALID_QFBUFNR;
4347  }
4348 
4349  FOR_ALL_TAB_WINDOWS(tp, win)
4350  if (is_qf_win(win, qi))
4351  return win->w_buffer;
4352 
4353  return NULL;
4354 }
4355 
4356 /*
4357  * Update the w:quickfix_title variable in the quickfix/location list window
4358  */
4359  static void
4360 qf_update_win_titlevar(qf_info_T *qi)
4361 {
4362  win_T *win;
4363  win_T *curwin_save;
4364 
4365  if ((win = qf_find_win(qi)) != NULL)
4366  {
4367  curwin_save = curwin;
4368  curwin = win;
4369  qf_set_title_var(qf_get_curlist(qi));
4370  curwin = curwin_save;
4371  }
4372 }
4373 
4374 /*
4375  * Find the quickfix buffer. If it exists, update the contents.
4376  */
4377  static void
4378 qf_update_buffer(qf_info_T *qi, qfline_T *old_last)
4379 {
4380  buf_T *buf;
4381  win_T *win;
4382  aco_save_T aco;
4383 
4384  // Check if a buffer for the quickfix list exists. Update it.
4385  buf = qf_find_buf(qi);
4386  if (buf != NULL)
4387  {
4388  linenr_T old_line_count = buf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
4389 
4390  if (old_last == NULL)
4391  // set curwin/curbuf to buf and save a few things
4392  aucmd_prepbuf(&aco, buf);
4393 
4394  qf_update_win_titlevar(qi);
4395 
4396  qf_fill_buffer(qf_get_curlist(qi), buf, old_last);
4397  ++CHANGEDTICK(buf);
4398 
4399  if (old_last == NULL)
4400  {
4401  (void)qf_win_pos_update(qi, 0);
4402 
4403  // restore curwin/curbuf and a few other things
4404  aucmd_restbuf(&aco);
4405  }
4406 
4407  // Only redraw when added lines are visible. This avoids flickering
4408  // when the added lines are not visible.
4409  if ((win = qf_find_win(qi)) != NULL && old_line_count < win->w_botline)
4410  redraw_buf_later(buf, NOT_VALID);
4411  }
4412 }
4413 
4414 /*
4415  * Add an error line to the quickfix buffer.
4416  */
4417  static int
4418 qf_buf_add_line(buf_T *buf, linenr_T lnum, qfline_T *qfp, char_u *dirname)
4419 {
4420  int len;
4421  buf_T *errbuf;
4422 
4423  if (qfp->qf_module != NULL)
4424  {
4425  STRCPY(IObuff, qfp->qf_module);
4426  len = (int)STRLEN(IObuff);
4427  }
4428  else if (qfp->qf_fnum != 0
4429  && (errbuf = buflist_findnr(qfp->qf_fnum)) != NULL
4430  && errbuf->b_fname != NULL)
4431  {
4432  if (qfp->qf_type == 1) // :helpgrep
4433  STRCPY(IObuff, gettail(errbuf->b_fname));
4434  else
4435  {
4436  // shorten the file name if not done already
4437  if (errbuf->b_sfname == NULL
4438  || mch_isFullName(errbuf->b_sfname))
4439  {
4440  if (*dirname == NUL)
4441  mch_dirname(dirname, MAXPATHL);
4442  shorten_buf_fname(errbuf, dirname, FALSE);
4443  }
4444  STRCPY(IObuff, errbuf->b_fname);
4445  }
4446  len = (int)STRLEN(IObuff);
4447  }
4448  else
4449  len = 0;
4450  IObuff[len++] = '|';
4451 
4452  if (qfp->qf_lnum > 0)
4453  {
4454  sprintf((char *)IObuff + len, "%ld", qfp->qf_lnum);
4455  len += (int)STRLEN(IObuff + len);
4456 
4457  if (qfp->qf_col > 0)
4458  {
4459  sprintf((char *)IObuff + len, " col %d", qfp->qf_col);
4460  len += (int)STRLEN(IObuff + len);
4461  }
4462 
4463  sprintf((char *)IObuff + len, "%s",
4464  (char *)qf_types(qfp->qf_type, qfp->qf_nr));
4465  len += (int)STRLEN(IObuff + len);
4466  }
4467  else if (qfp->qf_pattern != NULL)
4468  {
4469  qf_fmt_text(qfp->qf_pattern, IObuff + len, IOSIZE - len);
4470  len += (int)STRLEN(IObuff + len);
4471  }
4472  IObuff[len++] = '|';
4473  IObuff[len++] = ' ';
4474 
4475  // Remove newlines and leading whitespace from the text.
4476  // For an unrecognized line keep the indent, the compiler may
4477  // mark a word with ^^^^.
4478  qf_fmt_text(len > 3 ? skipwhite(qfp->qf_text) : qfp->qf_text,
4479  IObuff + len, IOSIZE - len);
4480 
4481  if (ml_append_buf(buf, lnum, IObuff,
4482  (colnr_T)STRLEN(IObuff) + 1, FALSE) == FAIL)
4483  return FAIL;
4484 
4485  return OK;
4486 }
4487 
4488 /*
4489  * Fill current buffer with quickfix errors, replacing any previous contents.
4490  * curbuf must be the quickfix buffer!
4491  * If "old_last" is not NULL append the items after this one.
4492  * When "old_last" is NULL then "buf" must equal "curbuf"! Because
4493  * ml_delete() is used and autocommands will be triggered.
4494  */
4495  static void
4496 qf_fill_buffer(qf_list_T *qfl, buf_T *buf, qfline_T *old_last)
4497 {
4498  linenr_T lnum;
4499  qfline_T *qfp;
4500  int old_KeyTyped = KeyTyped;
4501 
4502  if (old_last == NULL)
4503  {
4504  if (buf != curbuf)
4505  {
4506  internal_error("qf_fill_buffer()");
4507  return;
4508  }
4509 
4510  // delete all existing lines
4511  while ((curbuf->b_ml.ml_flags & ML_EMPTY) == 0)
4512  (void)ml_delete((linenr_T)1, FALSE);
4513  }
4514 
4515  // Check if there is anything to display
4516  if (qfl != NULL)
4517  {
4518  char_u dirname[MAXPATHL];
4519 
4520  *dirname = NUL;
4521 
4522  // Add one line for each error
4523  if (old_last == NULL)
4524  {
4525  qfp = qfl->qf_start;
4526  lnum = 0;
4527  }
4528  else
4529  {
4530  qfp = old_last->qf_next;
4531  lnum = buf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
4532  }
4533  while (lnum < qfl->qf_count)
4534  {
4535  if (qf_buf_add_line(buf, lnum, qfp, dirname) == FAIL)
4536  break;
4537 
4538  ++lnum;
4539  qfp = qfp->qf_next;
4540  if (qfp == NULL)
4541  break;
4542  }
4543 
4544  if (old_last == NULL)
4545  // Delete the empty line which is now at the end
4546  (void)ml_delete(lnum + 1, FALSE);
4547  }
4548 
4549  // correct cursor position
4550  check_lnums(TRUE);
4551 
4552  if (old_last == NULL)
4553  {
4554  // Set the 'filetype' to "qf" each time after filling the buffer.
4555  // This resembles reading a file into a buffer, it's more logical when
4556  // using autocommands.
4557  ++curbuf_lock;
4558  set_option_value((char_u *)"ft", 0L, (char_u *)"qf", OPT_LOCAL);
4559  curbuf->b_p_ma = FALSE;
4560 
4561  keep_filetype = TRUE; // don't detect 'filetype'
4562  apply_autocmds(EVENT_BUFREADPOST, (char_u *)"quickfix", NULL,
4563  FALSE, curbuf);
4564  apply_autocmds(EVENT_BUFWINENTER, (char_u *)"quickfix", NULL,
4565  FALSE, curbuf);
4566  keep_filetype = FALSE;
4567  --curbuf_lock;
4568 
4569  // make sure it will be redrawn
4570  redraw_curbuf_later(NOT_VALID);
4571  }
4572 
4573  // Restore KeyTyped, setting 'filetype' may reset it.
4574  KeyTyped = old_KeyTyped;
4575 }
4576 
4577 /*
4578  * For every change made to the quickfix list, update the changed tick.
4579  */
4580  static void
4581 qf_list_changed(qf_list_T *qfl)
4582 {
4583  qfl->qf_changedtick++;
4584 }
4585 
4586 /*
4587  * Return the quickfix/location list number with the given identifier.
4588  * Returns -1 if list is not found.
4589  */
4590  static int
4591 qf_id2nr(qf_info_T *qi, int_u qfid)
4592 {
4593  int qf_idx;
4594 
4595  for (qf_idx = 0; qf_idx < qi->qf_listcount; qf_idx++)
4596  if (qi->qf_lists[qf_idx].qf_id == qfid)
4597  return qf_idx;
4598  return INVALID_QFIDX;
4599 }
4600 
4601 /*
4602  * If the current list is not "save_qfid" and we can find the list with that ID
4603  * then make it the current list.
4604  * This is used when autocommands may have changed the current list.
4605  * Returns OK if successfully restored the list. Returns FAIL if the list with
4606  * the specified identifier (save_qfid) is not found in the stack.
4607  */
4608  static int
4609 qf_restore_list(qf_info_T *qi, int_u save_qfid)
4610 {
4611  int curlist;
4612 
4613  if (qf_get_curlist(qi)->qf_id != save_qfid)
4614  {
4615  curlist = qf_id2nr(qi, save_qfid);
4616  if (curlist < 0)
4617  // list is not present
4618  return FAIL;
4619  qi->qf_curlist = curlist;
4620  }
4621  return OK;
4622 }
4623 
4624 /*
4625  * Jump to the first entry if there is one.
4626  */
4627  static void
4628 qf_jump_first(qf_info_T *qi, int_u save_qfid, int forceit)
4629 {
4630  if (qf_restore_list(qi, save_qfid) == FAIL)
4631  return;
4632 
4633  // Autocommands might have cleared the list, check for that.
4634  if (!qf_list_empty(qf_get_curlist(qi)))
4635  qf_jump(qi, 0, 0, forceit);
4636 }
4637 
4638 /*
4639  * Return TRUE when using ":vimgrep" for ":grep".
4640  */
4641  int
4642 grep_internal(cmdidx_T cmdidx)
4643 {
4644  return ((cmdidx == CMD_grep
4645  || cmdidx == CMD_lgrep
4646  || cmdidx == CMD_grepadd
4647  || cmdidx == CMD_lgrepadd)
4648  && STRCMP("internal",
4649  *curbuf->b_p_gp == NUL ? p_gp : curbuf->b_p_gp) == 0);
4650 }
4651 
4652 /*
4653  * Return the make/grep autocmd name.
4654  */
4655  static char_u *
4656 make_get_auname(cmdidx_T cmdidx)
4657 {
4658  switch (cmdidx)
4659  {
4660  case CMD_make: return (char_u *)"make";
4661  case CMD_lmake: return (char_u *)"lmake";
4662  case CMD_grep: return (char_u *)"grep";
4663  case CMD_lgrep: return (char_u *)"lgrep";
4664  case CMD_grepadd: return (char_u *)"grepadd";
4665  case CMD_lgrepadd: return (char_u *)"lgrepadd";
4666  default: return NULL;
4667  }
4668 }
4669 
4670 /*
4671  * Return the name for the errorfile, in allocated memory.
4672  * Find a new unique name when 'makeef' contains "##".
4673  * Returns NULL for error.
4674  */
4675  static char_u *
4676 get_mef_name(void)
4677 {
4678  char_u *p;
4679  char_u *name;
4680  static int start = -1;
4681  static int off = 0;
4682 #ifdef HAVE_LSTAT
4683  stat_T sb;
4684 #endif
4685 
4686  if (*p_mef == NUL)
4687  {
4688  name = vim_tempname('e', FALSE);
4689  if (name == NULL)
4690  emsg(_(e_notmp));
4691  return name;
4692  }
4693 
4694  for (p = p_mef; *p; ++p)
4695  if (p[0] == '#' && p[1] == '#')
4696  break;
4697 
4698  if (*p == NUL)
4699  return vim_strsave(p_mef);
4700 
4701  // Keep trying until the name doesn't exist yet.
4702  for (;;)
4703  {
4704  if (start == -1)
4705  start = mch_get_pid();
4706  else
4707  off += 19;
4708 
4709  name = alloc(STRLEN(p_mef) + 30);
4710  if (name == NULL)
4711  break;
4712  STRCPY(name, p_mef);
4713  sprintf((char *)name + (p - p_mef), "%d%d", start, off);
4714  STRCAT(name, p + 2);
4715  if (mch_getperm(name) < 0
4716 #ifdef HAVE_LSTAT
4717  // Don't accept a symbolic link, it's a security risk.
4718  && mch_lstat((char *)name, &sb) < 0
4719 #endif
4720  )
4721  break;
4722  vim_free(name);
4723  }
4724  return name;
4725 }
4726 
4727 /*
4728  * Form the complete command line to invoke 'make'/'grep'. Quote the command
4729  * using 'shellquote' and append 'shellpipe'. Echo the fully formed command.
4730  */
4731  static char_u *
4732 make_get_fullcmd(char_u *makecmd, char_u *fname)
4733 {
4734  char_u *cmd;
4735  unsigned len;
4736 
4737  len = (unsigned)STRLEN(p_shq) * 2 + (unsigned)STRLEN(makecmd) + 1;
4738  if (*p_sp != NUL)
4739  len += (unsigned)STRLEN(p_sp) + (unsigned)STRLEN(fname) + 3;
4740  cmd = alloc(len);
4741  if (cmd == NULL)
4742  return NULL;
4743  sprintf((char *)cmd, "%s%s%s", (char *)p_shq, (char *)makecmd,
4744  (char *)p_shq);
4745 
4746  // If 'shellpipe' empty: don't redirect to 'errorfile'.
4747  if (*p_sp != NUL)
4748  append_redir(cmd, len, p_sp, fname);
4749 
4750  // Display the fully formed command. Output a newline if there's something
4751  // else than the :make command that was typed (in which case the cursor is
4752  // in column 0).
4753  if (msg_col == 0)
4754  msg_didout = FALSE;
4755  msg_start();
4756  msg_puts(":!");
4757  msg_outtrans(cmd); // show what we are doing
4758 
4759  return cmd;
4760 }
4761 
4762 /*
4763  * Used for ":make", ":lmake", ":grep", ":lgrep", ":grepadd", and ":lgrepadd"
4764  */
4765  void
4766 ex_make(exarg_T *eap)
4767 {
4768  char_u *fname;
4769  char_u *cmd;
4770  char_u *enc = NULL;
4771  win_T *wp = NULL;
4772  qf_info_T *qi = &ql_info;
4773  int res;
4774  char_u *au_name = NULL;
4775  int_u save_qfid;
4776 
4777  // Redirect ":grep" to ":vimgrep" if 'grepprg' is "internal".
4778  if (grep_internal(eap->cmdidx))
4779  {
4780  ex_vimgrep(eap);
4781  return;
4782  }
4783 
4784  au_name = make_get_auname(eap->cmdidx);
4785  if (au_name != NULL && apply_autocmds(EVENT_QUICKFIXCMDPRE, au_name,
4786  curbuf->b_fname, TRUE, curbuf))
4787  {
4788 #ifdef FEAT_EVAL
4789  if (aborting())
4790  return;
4791 #endif
4792  }
4793  enc = (*curbuf->b_p_menc != NUL) ? curbuf->b_p_menc : p_menc;
4794 
4795  if (is_loclist_cmd(eap->cmdidx))
4796  wp = curwin;
4797 
4798  autowrite_all();
4799  fname = get_mef_name();
4800  if (fname == NULL)
4801  return;
4802  mch_remove(fname); // in case it's not unique
4803 
4804  cmd = make_get_fullcmd(eap->arg, fname);
4805  if (cmd == NULL)
4806  return;
4807 
4808  // let the shell know if we are redirecting output or not
4809  do_shell(cmd, *p_sp != NUL ? SHELL_DOOUT : 0);
4810 
4811 #ifdef AMIGA
4812  out_flush();
4813  // read window status report and redraw before message
4814  (void)char_avail();
4815 #endif
4816 
4817  incr_quickfix_busy();
4818 
4819  res = qf_init(wp, fname, (eap->cmdidx != CMD_make
4820  && eap->cmdidx != CMD_lmake) ? p_gefm : p_efm,
4821  (eap->cmdidx != CMD_grepadd
4822  && eap->cmdidx != CMD_lgrepadd),
4823  qf_cmdtitle(*eap->cmdlinep), enc);
4824  if (wp != NULL)
4825  {
4826  qi = GET_LOC_LIST(wp);
4827  if (qi == NULL)
4828  goto cleanup;
4829  }
4830  if (res >= 0)
4831  qf_list_changed(qf_get_curlist(qi));
4832 
4833  // Remember the current quickfix list identifier, so that we can
4834  // check for autocommands changing the current quickfix list.
4835  save_qfid = qf_get_curlist(qi)->qf_id;
4836  if (au_name != NULL)
4837  apply_autocmds(EVENT_QUICKFIXCMDPOST, au_name,
4838  curbuf->b_fname, TRUE, curbuf);
4839  if (res > 0 && !eap->forceit && qflist_valid(wp, save_qfid))
4840  // display the first error
4841  qf_jump_first(qi, save_qfid, FALSE);
4842 
4843 cleanup:
4844  decr_quickfix_busy();
4845  mch_remove(fname);
4846  vim_free(fname);
4847  vim_free(cmd);
4848 }
4849 
4850 /*
4851  * Returns the number of entries in the current quickfix/location list.
4852  */
4853  int
4854 qf_get_size(exarg_T *eap)
4855 {
4856  qf_info_T *qi;
4857 
4858  if ((qi = qf_cmd_get_stack(eap, FALSE)) == NULL)
4859  return 0;
4860  return qf_get_curlist(qi)->qf_count;
4861 }
4862 
4863 /*
4864  * Returns the number of valid entries in the current quickfix/location list.
4865  */
4866  int
4867 qf_get_valid_size(exarg_T *eap)
4868 {
4869  qf_info_T *qi;
4870  qf_list_T *qfl;
4871  qfline_T *qfp;
4872  int i, sz = 0;
4873  int prev_fnum = 0;
4874 
4875  if ((qi = qf_cmd_get_stack(eap, FALSE)) == NULL)
4876  return 0;
4877 
4878  qfl = qf_get_curlist(qi);
4879  FOR_ALL_QFL_ITEMS(qfl, qfp, i)
4880  {
4881  if (qfp->qf_valid)
4882  {
4883  if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_cdo || eap->cmdidx == CMD_ldo)
4884  sz++; // Count all valid entries
4885  else if (qfp->qf_fnum > 0 && qfp->qf_fnum != prev_fnum)
4886  {
4887  // Count the number of files
4888  sz++;
4889  prev_fnum = qfp->qf_fnum;
4890  }
4891  }
4892  }
4893 
4894  return sz;
4895 }
4896 
4897 /*
4898  * Returns the current index of the quickfix/location list.
4899  * Returns 0 if there is an error.
4900  */
4901  int
4902 qf_get_cur_idx(exarg_T *eap)
4903 {
4904  qf_info_T *qi;
4905 
4906  if ((qi = qf_cmd_get_stack(eap, FALSE)) == NULL)
4907  return 0;
4908 
4909  return qf_get_curlist(qi)->qf_index;
4910 }
4911 
4912 /*
4913  * Returns the current index in the quickfix/location list (counting only valid
4914  * entries). If no valid entries are in the list, then returns 1.
4915  */
4916  int
4917 qf_get_cur_valid_idx(exarg_T *eap)
4918 {
4919  qf_info_T *qi;
4920  qf_list_T *qfl;
4921  qfline_T *qfp;
4922  int i, eidx = 0;
4923  int prev_fnum = 0;
4924 
4925  if ((qi = qf_cmd_get_stack(eap, FALSE)) == NULL)
4926  return 1;
4927 
4928  qfl = qf_get_curlist(qi);
4929  qfp = qfl->qf_start;
4930 
4931  // check if the list has valid errors
4932  if (!qf_list_has_valid_entries(qfl))
4933  return 1;
4934 
4935  for (i = 1; i <= qfl->qf_index && qfp!= NULL; i++, qfp = qfp->qf_next)
4936  {
4937  if (qfp->qf_valid)
4938  {
4939  if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_cfdo || eap->cmdidx == CMD_lfdo)
4940  {
4941  if (qfp->qf_fnum > 0 && qfp->qf_fnum != prev_fnum)
4942  {
4943  // Count the number of files
4944  eidx++;
4945  prev_fnum = qfp->qf_fnum;
4946  }
4947  }
4948  else
4949  eidx++;
4950  }
4951  }
4952 
4953  return eidx ? eidx : 1;
4954 }
4955 
4956 /*
4957  * Get the 'n'th valid error entry in the quickfix or location list.
4958  * Used by :cdo, :ldo, :cfdo and :lfdo commands.
4959  * For :cdo and :ldo returns the 'n'th valid error entry.
4960  * For :cfdo and :lfdo returns the 'n'th valid file entry.
4961  */
4962  static int
4963 qf_get_nth_valid_entry(qf_list_T *qfl, int n, int fdo)
4964 {
4965  qfline_T *qfp;
4966  int i, eidx;
4967  int prev_fnum = 0;
4968 
4969  // check if the list has valid errors
4970  if (!qf_list_has_valid_entries(qfl))
4971  return 1;
4972 
4973  eidx = 0;
4974  FOR_ALL_QFL_ITEMS(qfl, qfp, i)
4975  {
4976  if (qfp->qf_valid)
4977  {
4978  if (fdo)
4979  {
4980  if (qfp->qf_fnum > 0 && qfp->qf_fnum != prev_fnum)
4981  {
4982  // Count the number of files
4983  eidx++;
4984  prev_fnum = qfp->qf_fnum;
4985  }
4986  }
4987  else
4988  eidx++;
4989  }
4990 
4991  if (eidx == n)
4992  break;
4993  }
4994 
4995  if (i <= qfl->qf_count)
4996  return i;
4997  else
4998  return 1;
4999 }
5000 
5001 /*
5002  * ":cc", ":crewind", ":cfirst" and ":clast".
5003  * ":ll", ":lrewind", ":lfirst" and ":llast".
5004  * ":cdo", ":ldo", ":cfdo" and ":lfdo"
5005  */
5006  void
5007 ex_cc(exarg_T *eap)
5008 {
5009  qf_info_T *qi;
5010  int errornr;
5011 
5012  if ((qi = qf_cmd_get_stack(eap, TRUE)) == NULL)
5013  return;
5014 
5015  if (eap->addr_count > 0)
5016  errornr = (int)eap->line2;
5017  else
5018  {
5019  switch (eap->cmdidx)
5020  {
5021  case CMD_cc: case CMD_ll:
5022  errornr = 0;
5023  break;
5024  case CMD_crewind: case CMD_lrewind: case CMD_cfirst:
5025  case CMD_lfirst:
5026  errornr = 1;
5027  break;
5028  default:
5029  errornr = 32767;
5030  }
5031  }
5032 
5033  // For cdo and ldo commands, jump to the nth valid error.
5034  // For cfdo and lfdo commands, jump to the nth valid file entry.
5035  if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_cdo || eap->cmdidx == CMD_ldo
5036  || eap->cmdidx == CMD_cfdo || eap->cmdidx == CMD_lfdo)
5037  errornr = qf_get_nth_valid_entry(qf_get_curlist(qi),
5038  eap->addr_count > 0 ? (int)eap->line1 : 1,
5039  eap->cmdidx == CMD_cfdo || eap->cmdidx == CMD_lfdo);
5040 
5041  qf_jump(qi, 0, errornr, eap->forceit);
5042 }
5043 
5044 /*
5045  * ":cnext", ":cnfile", ":cNext" and ":cprevious".
5046  * ":lnext", ":lNext", ":lprevious", ":lnfile", ":lNfile" and ":lpfile".
5047  * Also, used by ":cdo", ":ldo", ":cfdo" and ":lfdo" commands.
5048  */
5049  void
5050 ex_cnext(exarg_T *eap)
5051 {
5052  qf_info_T *qi;
5053  int errornr;
5054  int dir;
5055 
5056  if ((qi = qf_cmd_get_stack(eap, TRUE)) == NULL)
5057  return;
5058 
5059  if (eap->addr_count > 0
5060  && (eap->cmdidx != CMD_cdo && eap->cmdidx != CMD_ldo
5061  && eap->cmdidx != CMD_cfdo && eap->cmdidx != CMD_lfdo))
5062  errornr = (int)eap->line2;
5063  else
5064  errornr = 1;
5065 
5066  // Depending on the command jump to either next or previous entry/file.
5067  switch (eap->cmdidx)
5068  {
5069  case CMD_cnext: case CMD_lnext: case CMD_cdo: case CMD_ldo:
5070  dir = FORWARD;
5071  break;
5072  case CMD_cprevious: case CMD_lprevious: case CMD_cNext:
5073  case CMD_lNext:
5074  dir = BACKWARD;
5075  break;
5076  case CMD_cnfile: case CMD_lnfile: case CMD_cfdo: case CMD_lfdo:
5077  dir = FORWARD_FILE;
5078  break;
5079  case CMD_cpfile: case CMD_lpfile: case CMD_cNfile: case CMD_lNfile:
5080  dir = BACKWARD_FILE;
5081  break;
5082  default:
5083  dir = FORWARD;
5084  break;
5085  }
5086 
5087  qf_jump(qi, dir, errornr, eap->forceit);
5088 }
5089 
5090 /*
5091  * Find the first entry in the quickfix list 'qfl' from buffer 'bnr'.
5092  * The index of the entry is stored in 'errornr'.
5093  * Returns NULL if an entry is not found.
5094  */
5095  static qfline_T *
5096 qf_find_first_entry_in_buf(qf_list_T *qfl, int bnr, int *errornr)
5097 {
5098  qfline_T *qfp = NULL;
5099  int idx = 0;
5100 
5101  // Find the first entry in this file
5102  FOR_ALL_QFL_ITEMS(qfl, qfp, idx)
5103  if (qfp->qf_fnum == bnr)
5104  break;
5105 
5106  *errornr = idx;
5107  return qfp;
5108 }
5109 
5110 /*
5111  * Find the first quickfix entry on the same line as 'entry'. Updates 'errornr'
5112  * with the error number for the first entry. Assumes the entries are sorted in
5113  * the quickfix list by line number.
5114  */
5115  static qfline_T *
5116 qf_find_first_entry_on_line(qfline_T *entry, int *errornr)
5117 {
5118  while (!got_int
5119  && entry->qf_prev != NULL
5120  && entry->qf_fnum == entry->qf_prev->qf_fnum
5121  && entry->qf_lnum == entry->qf_prev->qf_lnum)
5122  {
5123  entry = entry->qf_prev;
5124  --*errornr;
5125  }
5126 
5127  return entry;
5128 }
5129 
5130 /*
5131  * Find the last quickfix entry on the same line as 'entry'. Updates 'errornr'
5132  * with the error number for the last entry. Assumes the entries are sorted in
5133  * the quickfix list by line number.
5134  */
5135  static qfline_T *
5136 qf_find_last_entry_on_line(qfline_T *entry, int *errornr)
5137 {
5138  while (!got_int &&
5139  entry->qf_next != NULL
5140  && entry->qf_fnum == entry->qf_next->qf_fnum
5141  && entry->qf_lnum == entry->qf_next->qf_lnum)
5142  {
5143  entry = entry->qf_next;
5144  ++*errornr;
5145  }
5146 
5147  return entry;
5148 }
5149 
5150 /*
5151  * Returns TRUE if the specified quickfix entry is
5152  * after the given line (linewise is TRUE)
5153  * or after the line and column.
5154  */
5155  static int
5156 qf_entry_after_pos(qfline_T *qfp, pos_T *pos, int linewise)
5157 {
5158  if (linewise)
5159  return qfp->qf_lnum > pos->lnum;
5160  else
5161  return (qfp->qf_lnum > pos->lnum ||
5162  (qfp->qf_lnum == pos->lnum && qfp->qf_col > pos->col));
5163 }
5164 
5165 /*
5166  * Returns TRUE if the specified quickfix entry is
5167  * before the given line (linewise is TRUE)
5168  * or before the line and column.
5169  */
5170  static int
5171 qf_entry_before_pos(qfline_T *qfp, pos_T *pos, int linewise)
5172 {
5173  if (linewise)
5174  return qfp->qf_lnum < pos->lnum;
5175  else
5176  return (qfp->qf_lnum < pos->lnum ||
5177  (qfp->qf_lnum == pos->lnum && qfp->qf_col < pos->col));
5178 }
5179 
5180 /*
5181  * Returns TRUE if the specified quickfix entry is
5182  * on or after the given line (linewise is TRUE)
5183  * or on or after the line and column.
5184  */
5185  static int
5186 qf_entry_on_or_after_pos(qfline_T *qfp, pos_T *pos, int linewise)
5187 {
5188  if (linewise)
5189  return qfp->qf_lnum >= pos->lnum;
5190  else
5191  return (qfp->qf_lnum > pos->lnum ||
5192  (qfp->qf_lnum == pos->lnum && qfp->qf_col >= pos->col));
5193 }
5194 
5195 /*
5196  * Returns TRUE if the specified quickfix entry is
5197  * on or before the given line (linewise is TRUE)
5198  * or on or before the line and column.
5199  */
5200  static int
5201 qf_entry_on_or_before_pos(qfline_T *qfp, pos_T *pos, int linewise)
5202 {
5203  if (linewise)
5204  return qfp->qf_lnum <= pos->lnum;
5205  else
5206  return (qfp->qf_lnum < pos->lnum ||
5207  (qfp->qf_lnum == pos->lnum && qfp->qf_col <= pos->col));
5208 }
5209 
5210 /*
5211  * Find the first quickfix entry after position 'pos' in buffer 'bnr'.
5212  * If 'linewise' is TRUE, returns the entry after the specified line and treats
5213  * multiple entries on a single line as one. Otherwise returns the entry after
5214  * the specified line and column.
5215  * 'qfp' points to the very first entry in the buffer and 'errornr' is the
5216  * index of the very first entry in the quickfix list.
5217  * Returns NULL if an entry is not found after 'pos'.
5218  */
5219  static qfline_T *
5220 qf_find_entry_after_pos(
5221  int bnr,
5222  pos_T *pos,
5223  int linewise,
5224  qfline_T *qfp,
5225  int *errornr)
5226 {
5227  if (qf_entry_after_pos(qfp, pos, linewise))
5228  // First entry is after postion 'pos'
5229  return qfp;
5230 
5231  // Find the entry just before or at the position 'pos'
5232  while (qfp->qf_next != NULL
5233  && qfp->qf_next->qf_fnum == bnr
5234  && qf_entry_on_or_before_pos(qfp->qf_next, pos, linewise))
5235  {
5236  qfp = qfp->qf_next;
5237  ++*errornr;
5238  }
5239 
5240  if (qfp->qf_next == NULL || qfp->qf_next->qf_fnum != bnr)
5241  // No entries found after position 'pos'
5242  return NULL;
5243 
5244  // Use the entry just after position 'pos'
5245  qfp = qfp->qf_next;
5246  ++*errornr;
5247 
5248  return qfp;
5249 }
5250 
5251 /*
5252  * Find the first quickfix entry before position 'pos' in buffer 'bnr'.
5253  * If 'linewise' is TRUE, returns the entry before the specified line and
5254  * treats multiple entries on a single line as one. Otherwise returns the entry
5255  * before the specified line and column.
5256  * 'qfp' points to the very first entry in the buffer and 'errornr' is the
5257  * index of the very first entry in the quickfix list.
5258  * Returns NULL if an entry is not found before 'pos'.
5259  */
5260  static qfline_T *
5261 qf_find_entry_before_pos(
5262  int bnr,
5263  pos_T *pos,
5264  int linewise,
5265  qfline_T *qfp,
5266  int *errornr)
5267 {
5268  // Find the entry just before the position 'pos'
5269  while (qfp->qf_next != NULL
5270  && qfp->qf_next->qf_fnum == bnr
5271  && qf_entry_before_pos(qfp->qf_next, pos, linewise))
5272  {
5273  qfp = qfp->qf_next;
5274  ++*errornr;
5275  }
5276 
5277  if (qf_entry_on_or_after_pos(qfp, pos, linewise))
5278  return NULL;
5279 
5280  if (linewise)
5281  // If multiple entries are on the same line, then use the first entry
5282  qfp = qf_find_first_entry_on_line(qfp, errornr);
5283 
5284  return qfp;
5285 }
5286 
5287 /*
5288  * Find a quickfix entry in 'qfl' closest to position 'pos' in buffer 'bnr' in
5289  * the direction 'dir'.
5290  */
5291  static qfline_T *
5292 qf_find_closest_entry(
5293  qf_list_T *qfl,
5294  int bnr,
5295  pos_T *pos,
5296  int dir,
5297  int linewise,
5298  int *errornr)
5299 {
5300  qfline_T *qfp;
5301 
5302  *errornr = 0;
5303 
5304  // Find the first entry in this file
5305  qfp = qf_find_first_entry_in_buf(qfl, bnr, errornr);
5306  if (qfp == NULL)
5307  return NULL; // no entry in this file
5308 
5309  if (dir == FORWARD)
5310  qfp = qf_find_entry_after_pos(bnr, pos, linewise, qfp, errornr);
5311  else
5312  qfp = qf_find_entry_before_pos(bnr, pos, linewise, qfp, errornr);
5313 
5314  return qfp;
5315 }
5316 
5317 /*
5318  * Get the nth quickfix entry below the specified entry. Searches forward in
5319  * the list. If linewise is TRUE, then treat multiple entries on a single line
5320  * as one.
5321  */
5322  static void
5323 qf_get_nth_below_entry(qfline_T *entry, int n, int linewise, int *errornr)
5324 {
5325  while (n-- > 0 && !got_int)
5326  {
5327  qfline_T *first_entry = entry;
5328  int first_errornr = *errornr;
5329 
5330  if (linewise)
5331  // Treat all the entries on the same line in this file as one
5332  entry = qf_find_last_entry_on_line(entry, errornr);
5333 
5334  if (entry->qf_next == NULL
5335  || entry->qf_next->qf_fnum != entry->qf_fnum)
5336  {
5337  if (linewise)
5338  {
5339  // If multiple entries are on the same line, then use the first
5340  // entry
5341  entry = first_entry;
5342  *errornr = first_errornr;
5343  }
5344  break;
5345  }
5346 
5347  entry = entry->qf_next;
5348  ++*errornr;
5349  }
5350 }
5351 
5352 /*
5353  * Get the nth quickfix entry above the specified entry. Searches backwards in
5354  * the list. If linewise is TRUE, then treat multiple entries on a single line
5355  * as one.
5356  */
5357  static void
5358 qf_get_nth_above_entry(qfline_T *entry, int n, int linewise, int *errornr)
5359 {
5360  while (n-- > 0 && !got_int)
5361  {
5362  if (entry->qf_prev == NULL
5363  || entry->qf_prev->qf_fnum != entry->qf_fnum)
5364  break;
5365 
5366  entry = entry->qf_prev;
5367  --*errornr;
5368 
5369  // If multiple entries are on the same line, then use the first entry
5370  if (linewise)
5371  entry = qf_find_first_entry_on_line(entry, errornr);
5372  }
5373 }
5374 
5375 /*
5376  * Find the n'th quickfix entry adjacent to position 'pos' in buffer 'bnr' in
5377  * the specified direction. Returns the error number in the quickfix list or 0
5378  * if an entry is not found.
5379  */
5380  static int
5381 qf_find_nth_adj_entry(
5382  qf_list_T *qfl,
5383  int bnr,
5384  pos_T *pos,
5385  int n,
5386  int dir,
5387  int linewise)
5388 {
5389  qfline_T *adj_entry;
5390  int errornr;
5391 
5392  // Find an entry closest to the specified position
5393  adj_entry = qf_find_closest_entry(qfl, bnr, pos, dir, linewise, &errornr);
5394  if (adj_entry == NULL)
5395  return 0;
5396 
5397  if (--n > 0)
5398  {
5399  // Go to the n'th entry in the current buffer
5400  if (dir == FORWARD)
5401  qf_get_nth_below_entry(adj_entry, n, linewise, &errornr);
5402  else
5403  qf_get_nth_above_entry(adj_entry, n, linewise, &errornr);
5404  }
5405 
5406  return errornr;
5407 }
5408 
5409 /*
5410  * Jump to a quickfix entry in the current file nearest to the current line or
5411  * current line/col.
5412  * ":cabove", ":cbelow", ":labove", ":lbelow", ":cafter", ":cbefore",
5413  * ":lafter" and ":lbefore" commands
5414  */
5415  void
5416 ex_cbelow(exarg_T *eap)
5417 {
5418  qf_info_T *qi;
5419  qf_list_T *qfl;
5420  int dir;
5421  int buf_has_flag;
5422  int errornr = 0;
5423  pos_T pos;
5424 
5425  if (eap->addr_count > 0 && eap->line2 <= 0)
5426  {
5427  emsg(_(e_invrange));
5428  return;
5429  }
5430 
5431  // Check whether the current buffer has any quickfix entries
5432  if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_cabove || eap->cmdidx == CMD_cbelow
5433  || eap->cmdidx == CMD_cbefore || eap->cmdidx == CMD_cafter)
5434  buf_has_flag = BUF_HAS_QF_ENTRY;
5435  else
5436  buf_has_flag = BUF_HAS_LL_ENTRY;
5437  if (!(curbuf->b_has_qf_entry & buf_has_flag))
5438  {
5439  emsg(_(e_quickfix));
5440  return;
5441  }
5442 
5443  if ((qi = qf_cmd_get_stack(eap, TRUE)) == NULL)
5444  return;
5445 
5446  qfl = qf_get_curlist(qi);
5447  // check if the list has valid errors
5448  if (!qf_list_has_valid_entries(qfl))
5449  {
5450  emsg(_(e_quickfix));
5451  return;
5452  }
5453 
5454  if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_cbelow
5455  || eap->cmdidx == CMD_lbelow
5456  || eap->cmdidx == CMD_cafter
5457  || eap->cmdidx == CMD_lafter)
5458  // Forward motion commands
5459  dir = FORWARD;
5460  else
5461  dir = BACKWARD;
5462 
5463  pos = curwin->w_cursor;
5464  // A quickfix entry column number is 1 based whereas cursor column
5465  // number is 0 based. Adjust the column number.
5466  pos.col++;
5467  errornr = qf_find_nth_adj_entry(qfl, curbuf->b_fnum, &pos,
5468  eap->addr_count > 0 ? eap->line2 : 0, dir,
5469  eap->cmdidx == CMD_cbelow
5470  || eap->cmdidx == CMD_lbelow
5471  || eap->cmdidx == CMD_cabove
5472  || eap->cmdidx == CMD_labove);
5473 
5474  if (errornr > 0)
5475  qf_jump(qi, 0, errornr, FALSE);
5476  else
5477  emsg(_(e_no_more_items));
5478 }
5479 
5480 /*
5481  * Return the autocmd name for the :cfile Ex commands
5482  */
5483  static char_u *
5484 cfile_get_auname(cmdidx_T cmdidx)
5485 {
5486  switch (cmdidx)
5487  {
5488  case CMD_cfile: return (char_u *)"cfile";
5489  case CMD_cgetfile: return (char_u *)"cgetfile";
5490  case CMD_caddfile: return (char_u *)"caddfile";
5491  case CMD_lfile: return (char_u *)"lfile";
5492  case CMD_lgetfile: return (char_u *)"lgetfile";
5493  case CMD_laddfile: return (char_u *)"laddfile";
5494  default: return NULL;
5495  }
5496 }
5497 
5498 /*
5499  * ":cfile"/":cgetfile"/":caddfile" commands.
5500  * ":lfile"/":lgetfile"/":laddfile" commands.
5501  */
5502  void
5503 ex_cfile(exarg_T *eap)
5504 {
5505  char_u *enc = NULL;
5506  win_T *wp = NULL;
5507  qf_info_T *qi = &ql_info;
5508  char_u *au_name = NULL;
5509  int_u save_qfid = 0; // init for gcc
5510  int res;
5511 
5512  au_name = cfile_get_auname(eap->cmdidx);
5513  if (au_name != NULL)
5514  apply_autocmds(EVENT_QUICKFIXCMDPRE, au_name, NULL, FALSE, curbuf);
5515 
5516  enc = (*curbuf->b_p_menc != NUL) ? curbuf->b_p_menc : p_menc;
5517 #ifdef FEAT_BROWSE
5518  if (cmdmod.browse)
5519  {
5520  char_u *browse_file = do_browse(0, (char_u *)_("Error file"), eap->arg,
5521  NULL, NULL,
5522  (char_u *)_(BROWSE_FILTER_ALL_FILES), NULL);
5523  if (browse_file == NULL)
5524  return;
5525  set_string_option_direct((char_u *)"ef", -1, browse_file, OPT_FREE, 0);
5526  vim_free(browse_file);
5527  }
5528  else
5529 #endif
5530  if (*eap->arg != NUL)
5531  set_string_option_direct((char_u *)"ef", -1, eap->arg, OPT_FREE, 0);
5532 
5533  if (is_loclist_cmd(eap->cmdidx))
5534  wp = curwin;
5535 
5536  incr_quickfix_busy();
5537 
5538  // This function is used by the :cfile, :cgetfile and :caddfile
5539  // commands.
5540  // :cfile always creates a new quickfix list and jumps to the
5541  // first error.
5542  // :cgetfile creates a new quickfix list but doesn't jump to the
5543  // first error.
5544  // :caddfile adds to an existing quickfix list. If there is no
5545  // quickfix list then a new list is created.
5546  res = qf_init(wp, p_ef, p_efm, (eap->cmdidx != CMD_caddfile
5547  && eap->cmdidx != CMD_laddfile),
5548  qf_cmdtitle(*eap->cmdlinep), enc);
5549  if (wp != NULL)
5550  {
5551  qi = GET_LOC_LIST(wp);
5552  if (qi == NULL)
5553  {
5554  decr_quickfix_busy();
5555  return;
5556  }
5557  }
5558  if (res >= 0)
5559  qf_list_changed(qf_get_curlist(qi));
5560  save_qfid = qf_get_curlist(qi)->qf_id;
5561  if (au_name != NULL)
5562  apply_autocmds(EVENT_QUICKFIXCMDPOST, au_name, NULL, FALSE, curbuf);
5563 
5564  // Jump to the first error for a new list and if autocmds didn't
5565  // free the list.
5566  if (res > 0 && (eap->cmdidx == CMD_cfile || eap->cmdidx == CMD_lfile)
5567  && qflist_valid(wp, save_qfid))
5568  // display the first error
5569  qf_jump_first(qi, save_qfid, eap->forceit);
5570 
5571  decr_quickfix_busy();
5572 }
5573 
5574 /*
5575  * Return the vimgrep autocmd name.
5576  */
5577  static char_u *
5578 vgr_get_auname(cmdidx_T cmdidx)
5579 {
5580  switch (cmdidx)
5581  {
5582  case CMD_vimgrep: return (char_u *)"vimgrep";
5583  case CMD_lvimgrep: return (char_u *)"lvimgrep";
5584  case CMD_vimgrepadd: return (char_u *)"vimgrepadd";
5585  case CMD_lvimgrepadd: return (char_u *)"lvimgrepadd";
5586  case CMD_grep: return (char_u *)"grep";
5587  case CMD_lgrep: return (char_u *)"lgrep";
5588  case CMD_grepadd: return (char_u *)"grepadd";
5589  case CMD_lgrepadd: return (char_u *)"lgrepadd";
5590  default: return NULL;
5591  }
5592 }
5593 
5594 /*
5595  * Initialize the regmatch used by vimgrep for pattern "s".
5596  */
5597  static void
5598 vgr_init_regmatch(regmmatch_T *regmatch, char_u *s)
5599 {
5600  // Get the search pattern: either white-separated or enclosed in //
5601  regmatch->regprog = NULL;
5602 
5603  if (s == NULL || *s == NUL)
5604  {
5605  // Pattern is empty, use last search pattern.
5606  if (last_search_pat() == NULL)
5607  {
5608  emsg(_(e_noprevre));
5609  return;
5610  }
5611  regmatch->regprog = vim_regcomp(last_search_pat(), RE_MAGIC);
5612  }
5613  else
5614  regmatch->regprog = vim_regcomp(s, RE_MAGIC);
5615 
5616  regmatch->rmm_ic = p_ic;
5617  regmatch->rmm_maxcol = 0;
5618 }
5619 
5620 /*
5621  * Display a file name when vimgrep is running.
5622  */
5623  static void
5624 vgr_display_fname(char_u *fname)
5625 {
5626  char_u *p;
5627 
5628  msg_start();
5629  p = msg_strtrunc(fname, TRUE);
5630  if (p == NULL)
5631  msg_outtrans(fname);
5632  else
5633  {
5634  msg_outtrans(p);
5635  vim_free(p);
5636  }
5637  msg_clr_eos();
5638  msg_didout = FALSE; // overwrite this message
5639  msg_nowait = TRUE; // don't wait for this message
5640  msg_col = 0;
5641  out_flush();
5642 }
5643 
5644 /*
5645  * Load a dummy buffer to search for a pattern using vimgrep.
5646  */
5647  static buf_T *
5648 vgr_load_dummy_buf(
5649  char_u *fname,
5650  char_u *dirname_start,
5651  char_u *dirname_now)
5652 {
5653  int save_mls;
5654 #if defined(FEAT_SYN_HL)
5655  char_u *save_ei = NULL;
5656 #endif
5657  buf_T *buf;
5658 
5659 #if defined(FEAT_SYN_HL)
5660  // Don't do Filetype autocommands to avoid loading syntax and
5661  // indent scripts, a great speed improvement.
5662  save_ei = au_event_disable(",Filetype");
5663 #endif
5664  // Don't use modelines here, it's useless.
5665  save_mls = p_mls;
5666  p_mls = 0;
5667 
5668  // Load file into a buffer, so that 'fileencoding' is detected,
5669  // autocommands applied, etc.
5670  buf = load_dummy_buffer(fname, dirname_start, dirname_now);
5671 
5672  p_mls = save_mls;
5673 #if defined(FEAT_SYN_HL)
5674  au_event_restore(save_ei);
5675 #endif
5676 
5677  return buf;
5678 }
5679 
5680 /*
5681  * Check whether a quickfix/location list is valid. Autocmds may remove or
5682  * change a quickfix list when vimgrep is running. If the list is not found,
5683  * create a new list.
5684  */
5685  static int
5686 vgr_qflist_valid(
5687  win_T *wp,
5688  qf_info_T *qi,
5689  int_u qfid,
5690  char_u *title)
5691 {
5692  // Verify that the quickfix/location list was not freed by an autocmd
5693  if (!qflist_valid(wp, qfid))
5694  {
5695  if (wp != NULL)
5696  {
5697  // An autocmd has freed the location list.
5698  emsg(_(e_loc_list_changed));
5699  return FALSE;
5700  }
5701  else
5702  {
5703  // Quickfix list is not found, create a new one.
5704  qf_new_list(qi, title);
5705  return TRUE;
5706  }
5707  }
5708 
5709  if (qf_restore_list(qi, qfid) == FAIL)
5710  return FALSE;
5711 
5712  return TRUE;
5713 }
5714 
5715 /*
5716  * Search for a pattern in all the lines in a buffer and add the matching lines
5717  * to a quickfix list.
5718  */
5719  static int
5720 vgr_match_buflines(
5721  qf_list_T *qfl,
5722  char_u *fname,
5723  buf_T *buf,
5724  regmmatch_T *regmatch,
5725  long *tomatch,
5726  int duplicate_name,
5727  int flags)
5728 {
5729  int found_match = FALSE;
5730  long lnum;
5731  colnr_T col;
5732 
5733  for (lnum = 1; lnum <= buf->b_ml.ml_line_count && *tomatch > 0; ++lnum)
5734  {
5735  col = 0;
5736  while (vim_regexec_multi(regmatch, curwin, buf, lnum,
5737  col, NULL, NULL) > 0)
5738  {
5739  // Pass the buffer number so that it gets used even for a
5740  // dummy buffer, unless duplicate_name is set, then the
5741  // buffer will be wiped out below.
5742  if (qf_add_entry(qfl,
5743  NULL, // dir
5744  fname,
5745  NULL,
5746  duplicate_name ? 0 : buf->b_fnum,
5747  ml_get_buf(buf,
5748  regmatch->startpos[0].lnum + lnum, FALSE),
5749  regmatch->startpos[0].lnum + lnum,
5750  regmatch->startpos[0].col + 1,
5751  FALSE, // vis_col
5752  NULL, // search pattern
5753  0, // nr
5754  0, // type
5755  TRUE // valid
5756  ) == QF_FAIL)
5757  {
5758  got_int = TRUE;
5759  break;
5760  }
5761  found_match = TRUE;
5762  if (--*tomatch == 0)
5763  break;
5764  if ((flags & VGR_GLOBAL) == 0
5765  || regmatch->endpos[0].lnum > 0)
5766  break;
5767  col = regmatch->endpos[0].col
5768  + (col == regmatch->endpos[0].col);
5769  if (col > (colnr_T)STRLEN(ml_get_buf(buf, lnum, FALSE)))
5770  break;
5771  }
5772  line_breakcheck();
5773  if (got_int)
5774  break;
5775  }
5776 
5777  return found_match;
5778 }
5779 
5780 /*
5781  * Jump to the first match and update the directory.
5782  */
5783  static void
5784 vgr_jump_to_match(
5785  qf_info_T *qi,
5786  int forceit,
5787  int *redraw_for_dummy,
5788  buf_T *first_match_buf,
5789  char_u *target_dir)
5790 {
5791  buf_T *buf;
5792 
5793  buf = curbuf;
5794  qf_jump(qi, 0, 0, forceit);
5795  if (buf != curbuf)
5796  // If we jumped to another buffer redrawing will already be
5797  // taken care of.
5798  *redraw_for_dummy = FALSE;
5799 
5800  // Jump to the directory used after loading the buffer.
5801  if (curbuf == first_match_buf && target_dir != NULL)
5802  {
5803  exarg_T ea;
5804 
5805  vim_memset(&ea, 0, sizeof(ea));
5806  ea.arg = target_dir;
5807  ea.cmdidx = CMD_lcd;
5808  ex_cd(&ea);
5809  }
5810 }
5811 
5812 /*
5813  * ":vimgrep {pattern} file(s)"
5814  * ":vimgrepadd {pattern} file(s)"
5815  * ":lvimgrep {pattern} file(s)"
5816  * ":lvimgrepadd {pattern} file(s)"
5817  */
5818  void
5819 ex_vimgrep(exarg_T *eap)
5820 {
5821  regmmatch_T regmatch;
5822  int fcount;
5823  char_u **fnames;
5824  char_u *fname;
5825  char_u *title;
5826  char_u *s;
5827  char_u *p;
5828  int fi;
5829  qf_info_T *qi;
5830  qf_list_T *qfl;
5831  int_u save_qfid;
5832  win_T *wp = NULL;
5833  buf_T *buf;
5834  int duplicate_name = FALSE;
5835  int using_dummy;
5836  int redraw_for_dummy = FALSE;
5837  int found_match;
5838  buf_T *first_match_buf = NULL;
5839  time_t seconds = 0;
5840  aco_save_T aco;
5841  int flags = 0;
5842  long tomatch;
5843  char_u *dirname_start = NULL;
5844  char_u *dirname_now = NULL;
5845  char_u *target_dir = NULL;
5846  char_u *au_name = NULL;
5847 
5848  au_name = vgr_get_auname(eap->cmdidx);
5849  if (au_name != NULL && apply_autocmds(EVENT_QUICKFIXCMDPRE, au_name,
5850  curbuf->b_fname, TRUE, curbuf))
5851  {
5852 #ifdef FEAT_EVAL
5853  if (aborting())
5854  return;
5855 #endif
5856  }
5857 
5858  qi = qf_cmd_get_or_alloc_stack(eap, &wp);
5859  if (qi == NULL)
5860  return;
5861 
5862  if (eap->addr_count > 0)
5863  tomatch = eap->line2;
5864  else
5865  tomatch = MAXLNUM;
5866 
5867  // Get the search pattern: either white-separated or enclosed in //
5868  regmatch.regprog = NULL;
5869  title = vim_strsave(qf_cmdtitle(*eap->cmdlinep));
5870  p = skip_vimgrep_pat(eap->arg, &s, &flags);
5871  if (p == NULL)
5872  {
5873  emsg(_(e_invalpat));
5874  goto theend;
5875  }
5876 
5877  vgr_init_regmatch(&regmatch, s);
5878  if (regmatch.regprog == NULL)
5879  goto theend;
5880 
5881  p = skipwhite(p);
5882  if (*p == NUL)
5883  {
5884  emsg(_("E683: File name missing or invalid pattern"));
5885  goto theend;
5886  }
5887 
5888  if ((eap->cmdidx != CMD_grepadd && eap->cmdidx != CMD_lgrepadd
5889  && eap->cmdidx != CMD_vimgrepadd
5890  && eap->cmdidx != CMD_lvimgrepadd)
5891  || qf_stack_empty(qi))
5892  // make place for a new list
5893  qf_new_list(qi, title != NULL ? title : qf_cmdtitle(*eap->cmdlinep));
5894 
5895  // parse the list of arguments
5896  if (get_arglist_exp(p, &fcount, &fnames, TRUE) == FAIL)
5897  goto theend;
5898  if (fcount == 0)
5899  {
5900  emsg(_(e_nomatch));
5901  goto theend;
5902  }
5903 
5904  dirname_start = alloc_id(MAXPATHL, aid_qf_dirname_start);
5905  dirname_now = alloc_id(MAXPATHL, aid_qf_dirname_now);
5906  if (dirname_start == NULL || dirname_now == NULL)
5907  {
5908  FreeWild(fcount, fnames);
5909  goto theend;
5910  }
5911 
5912  // Remember the current directory, because a BufRead autocommand that does
5913  // ":lcd %:p:h" changes the meaning of short path names.
5914  mch_dirname(dirname_start, MAXPATHL);
5915 
5916  incr_quickfix_busy();
5917 
5918  // Remember the current quickfix list identifier, so that we can check for
5919  // autocommands changing the current quickfix list.
5920  save_qfid = qf_get_curlist(qi)->qf_id;
5921 
5922  seconds = (time_t)0;
5923  for (fi = 0; fi < fcount && !got_int && tomatch > 0; ++fi)
5924  {
5925  fname = shorten_fname1(fnames[fi]);
5926  if (time(NULL) > seconds)
5927  {
5928  // Display the file name every second or so, show the user we are
5929  // working on it.
5930  seconds = time(NULL);
5931  vgr_display_fname(fname);
5932  }
5933 
5934  buf = buflist_findname_exp(fnames[fi]);
5935  if (buf == NULL || buf->b_ml.ml_mfp == NULL)
5936  {
