5937  // Remember that a buffer with this name already exists.
5938  duplicate_name = (buf != NULL);
5939  using_dummy = TRUE;
5940  redraw_for_dummy = TRUE;
5941 
5942  buf = vgr_load_dummy_buf(fname, dirname_start, dirname_now);
5943  }
5944  else
5945  // Use existing, loaded buffer.
5946  using_dummy = FALSE;
5947 
5948  // Check whether the quickfix list is still valid. When loading a
5949  // buffer above, autocommands might have changed the quickfix list.
5950  if (!vgr_qflist_valid(wp, qi, save_qfid, qf_cmdtitle(*eap->cmdlinep)))
5951  {
5952  FreeWild(fcount, fnames);
5953  decr_quickfix_busy();
5954  goto theend;
5955  }
5956  save_qfid = qf_get_curlist(qi)->qf_id;
5957 
5958  if (buf == NULL)
5959  {
5960  if (!got_int)
5961  smsg(_("Cannot open file \"%s\""), fname);
5962  }
5963  else
5964  {
5965  // Try for a match in all lines of the buffer.
5966  // For ":1vimgrep" look for first match only.
5967  found_match = vgr_match_buflines(qf_get_curlist(qi),
5968  fname, buf, &regmatch,
5969  &tomatch, duplicate_name, flags);
5970 
5971  if (using_dummy)
5972  {
5973  if (found_match && first_match_buf == NULL)
5974  first_match_buf = buf;
5975  if (duplicate_name)
5976  {
5977  // Never keep a dummy buffer if there is another buffer
5978  // with the same name.
5979  wipe_dummy_buffer(buf, dirname_start);
5980  buf = NULL;
5981  }
5982  else if (!cmdmod.hide
5983  || buf->b_p_bh[0] == 'u' // "unload"
5984  || buf->b_p_bh[0] == 'w' // "wipe"
5985  || buf->b_p_bh[0] == 'd') // "delete"
5986  {
5987  // When no match was found we don't need to remember the
5988  // buffer, wipe it out. If there was a match and it
5989  // wasn't the first one or we won't jump there: only
5990  // unload the buffer.
5991  // Ignore 'hidden' here, because it may lead to having too
5992  // many swap files.
5993  if (!found_match)
5994  {
5995  wipe_dummy_buffer(buf, dirname_start);
5996  buf = NULL;
5997  }
5998  else if (buf != first_match_buf || (flags & VGR_NOJUMP))
5999  {
6000  unload_dummy_buffer(buf, dirname_start);
6001  // Keeping the buffer, remove the dummy flag.
6002  buf->b_flags &= ~BF_DUMMY;
6003  buf = NULL;
6004  }
6005  }
6006 
6007  if (buf != NULL)
6008  {
6009  // Keeping the buffer, remove the dummy flag.
6010  buf->b_flags &= ~BF_DUMMY;
6011 
6012  // If the buffer is still loaded we need to use the
6013  // directory we jumped to below.
6014  if (buf == first_match_buf
6015  && target_dir == NULL
6016  && STRCMP(dirname_start, dirname_now) != 0)
6017  target_dir = vim_strsave(dirname_now);
6018 
6019  // The buffer is still loaded, the Filetype autocommands
6020  // need to be done now, in that buffer. And the modelines
6021  // need to be done (again). But not the window-local
6022  // options!
6023  aucmd_prepbuf(&aco, buf);
6024 #if defined(FEAT_SYN_HL)
6025  apply_autocmds(EVENT_FILETYPE, buf->b_p_ft,
6026  buf->b_fname, TRUE, buf);
6027 #endif
6028  do_modelines(OPT_NOWIN);
6029  aucmd_restbuf(&aco);
6030  }
6031  }
6032  }
6033  }
6034 
6035  FreeWild(fcount, fnames);
6036 
6037  qfl = qf_get_curlist(qi);
6038  qfl->qf_nonevalid = FALSE;
6039  qfl->qf_ptr = qfl->qf_start;
6040  qfl->qf_index = 1;
6041  qf_list_changed(qfl);
6042 
6043  qf_update_buffer(qi, NULL);
6044 
6045  if (au_name != NULL)
6046  apply_autocmds(EVENT_QUICKFIXCMDPOST, au_name,
6047  curbuf->b_fname, TRUE, curbuf);
6048  // The QuickFixCmdPost autocmd may free the quickfix list. Check the list
6049  // is still valid.
6050  if (!qflist_valid(wp, save_qfid)
6051  || qf_restore_list(qi, save_qfid) == FAIL)
6052  {
6053  decr_quickfix_busy();
6054  goto theend;
6055  }
6056 
6057  // Jump to first match.
6058  if (!qf_list_empty(qf_get_curlist(qi)))
6059  {
6060  if ((flags & VGR_NOJUMP) == 0)
6061  vgr_jump_to_match(qi, eap->forceit, &redraw_for_dummy,
6062  first_match_buf, target_dir);
6063  }
6064  else
6065  semsg(_(e_nomatch2), s);
6066 
6067  decr_quickfix_busy();
6068 
6069  // If we loaded a dummy buffer into the current window, the autocommands
6070  // may have messed up things, need to redraw and recompute folds.
6071  if (redraw_for_dummy)
6072  {
6073 #ifdef FEAT_FOLDING
6074  foldUpdateAll(curwin);
6075 #else
6076  redraw_later(NOT_VALID);
6077 #endif
6078  }
6079 
6080 theend:
6081  vim_free(title);
6082  vim_free(dirname_now);
6083  vim_free(dirname_start);
6084  vim_free(target_dir);
6085  vim_regfree(regmatch.regprog);
6086 }
6087 
6088 /*
6089  * Restore current working directory to "dirname_start" if they differ, taking
6090  * into account whether it is set locally or globally.
6091  */
6092  static void
6093 restore_start_dir(char_u *dirname_start)
6094 {
6095  char_u *dirname_now = alloc(MAXPATHL);
6096 
6097  if (NULL != dirname_now)
6098  {
6099  mch_dirname(dirname_now, MAXPATHL);
6100  if (STRCMP(dirname_start, dirname_now) != 0)
6101  {
6102  // If the directory has changed, change it back by building up an
6103  // appropriate ex command and executing it.
6104  exarg_T ea;
6105 
6106  vim_memset(&ea, 0, sizeof(ea));
6107  ea.arg = dirname_start;
6108  ea.cmdidx = (curwin->w_localdir == NULL) ? CMD_cd : CMD_lcd;
6109  ex_cd(&ea);
6110  }
6111  vim_free(dirname_now);
6112  }
6113 }
6114 
6115 /*
6116  * Load file "fname" into a dummy buffer and return the buffer pointer,
6117  * placing the directory resulting from the buffer load into the
6118  * "resulting_dir" pointer. "resulting_dir" must be allocated by the caller
6119  * prior to calling this function. Restores directory to "dirname_start" prior
6120  * to returning, if autocmds or the 'autochdir' option have changed it.
6121  *
6122  * If creating the dummy buffer does not fail, must call unload_dummy_buffer()
6123  * or wipe_dummy_buffer() later!
6124  *
6125  * Returns NULL if it fails.
6126  */
6127  static buf_T *
6128 load_dummy_buffer(
6129  char_u *fname,
6130  char_u *dirname_start, // in: old directory
6131  char_u *resulting_dir) // out: new directory
6132 {
6133  buf_T *newbuf;
6134  bufref_T newbufref;
6135  bufref_T newbuf_to_wipe;
6136  int failed = TRUE;
6137  aco_save_T aco;
6138  int readfile_result;
6139 
6140  // Allocate a buffer without putting it in the buffer list.
6141  newbuf = buflist_new(NULL, NULL, (linenr_T)1, BLN_DUMMY);
6142  if (newbuf == NULL)
6143  return NULL;
6144  set_bufref(&newbufref, newbuf);
6145 
6146  // Init the options.
6147  buf_copy_options(newbuf, BCO_ENTER | BCO_NOHELP);
6148 
6149  // need to open the memfile before putting the buffer in a window
6150  if (ml_open(newbuf) == OK)
6151  {
6152  // Make sure this buffer isn't wiped out by autocommands.
6153  ++newbuf->b_locked;
6154 
6155  // set curwin/curbuf to buf and save a few things
6156  aucmd_prepbuf(&aco, newbuf);
6157 
6158  // Need to set the filename for autocommands.
6159  (void)setfname(curbuf, fname, NULL, FALSE);
6160 
6161  // Create swap file now to avoid the ATTENTION message.
6162  check_need_swap(TRUE);
6163 
6164  // Remove the "dummy" flag, otherwise autocommands may not
6165  // work.
6166  curbuf->b_flags &= ~BF_DUMMY;
6167 
6168  newbuf_to_wipe.br_buf = NULL;
6169  readfile_result = readfile(fname, NULL,
6170  (linenr_T)0, (linenr_T)0, (linenr_T)MAXLNUM,
6171  NULL, READ_NEW | READ_DUMMY);
6172  --newbuf->b_locked;
6173  if (readfile_result == OK
6174  && !got_int
6175  && !(curbuf->b_flags & BF_NEW))
6176  {
6177  failed = FALSE;
6178  if (curbuf != newbuf)
6179  {
6180  // Bloody autocommands changed the buffer! Can happen when
6181  // using netrw and editing a remote file. Use the current
6182  // buffer instead, delete the dummy one after restoring the
6183  // window stuff.
6184  set_bufref(&newbuf_to_wipe, newbuf);
6185  newbuf = curbuf;
6186  }
6187  }
6188 
6189  // restore curwin/curbuf and a few other things
6190  aucmd_restbuf(&aco);
6191  if (newbuf_to_wipe.br_buf != NULL && bufref_valid(&newbuf_to_wipe))
6192  wipe_buffer(newbuf_to_wipe.br_buf, FALSE);
6193 
6194  // Add back the "dummy" flag, otherwise buflist_findname_stat() won't
6195  // skip it.
6196  newbuf->b_flags |= BF_DUMMY;
6197  }
6198 
6199  // When autocommands/'autochdir' option changed directory: go back.
6200  // Let the caller know what the resulting dir was first, in case it is
6201  // important.
6202  mch_dirname(resulting_dir, MAXPATHL);
6203  restore_start_dir(dirname_start);
6204 
6205  if (!bufref_valid(&newbufref))
6206  return NULL;
6207  if (failed)
6208  {
6209  wipe_dummy_buffer(newbuf, dirname_start);
6210  return NULL;
6211  }
6212  return newbuf;
6213 }
6214 
6215 /*
6216  * Wipe out the dummy buffer that load_dummy_buffer() created. Restores
6217  * directory to "dirname_start" prior to returning, if autocmds or the
6218  * 'autochdir' option have changed it.
6219  */
6220  static void
6221 wipe_dummy_buffer(buf_T *buf, char_u *dirname_start)
6222 {
6223  if (curbuf != buf) // safety check
6224  {
6225 #if defined(FEAT_EVAL)
6226  cleanup_T cs;
6227 
6228  // Reset the error/interrupt/exception state here so that aborting()
6229  // returns FALSE when wiping out the buffer. Otherwise it doesn't
6230  // work when got_int is set.
6231  enter_cleanup(&cs);
6232 #endif
6233 
6234  wipe_buffer(buf, FALSE);
6235 
6236 #if defined(FEAT_EVAL)
6237  // Restore the error/interrupt/exception state if not discarded by a
6238  // new aborting error, interrupt, or uncaught exception.
6239  leave_cleanup(&cs);
6240 #endif
6241  // When autocommands/'autochdir' option changed directory: go back.
6242  restore_start_dir(dirname_start);
6243  }
6244 }
6245 
6246 /*
6247  * Unload the dummy buffer that load_dummy_buffer() created. Restores
6248  * directory to "dirname_start" prior to returning, if autocmds or the
6249  * 'autochdir' option have changed it.
6250  */
6251  static void
6252 unload_dummy_buffer(buf_T *buf, char_u *dirname_start)
6253 {
6254  if (curbuf != buf) // safety check
6255  {
6256  close_buffer(NULL, buf, DOBUF_UNLOAD, FALSE);
6257 
6258  // When autocommands/'autochdir' option changed directory: go back.
6259  restore_start_dir(dirname_start);
6260  }
6261 }
6262 
6263 #if defined(FEAT_EVAL) || defined(PROTO)
6264 /*
6265  * Copy the specified quickfix entry items into a new dict and appened the dict
6266  * to 'list'. Returns OK on success.
6267  */
6268  static int
6269 get_qfline_items(qfline_T *qfp, list_T *list)
6270 {
6271  int bufnum;
6272  dict_T *dict;
6273  char_u buf[2];
6274 
6275  // Handle entries with a non-existing buffer number.
6276  bufnum = qfp->qf_fnum;
6277  if (bufnum != 0 && (buflist_findnr(bufnum) == NULL))
6278  bufnum = 0;
6279 
6280  if ((dict = dict_alloc()) == NULL)
6281  return FAIL;
6282  if (list_append_dict(list, dict) == FAIL)
6283  return FAIL;
6284 
6285  buf[0] = qfp->qf_type;
6286  buf[1] = NUL;
6287  if (dict_add_number(dict, "bufnr", (long)bufnum) == FAIL
6288  || dict_add_number(dict, "lnum", (long)qfp->qf_lnum) == FAIL
6289  || dict_add_number(dict, "col", (long)qfp->qf_col) == FAIL
6290  || dict_add_number(dict, "vcol", (long)qfp->qf_viscol) == FAIL
6291  || dict_add_number(dict, "nr", (long)qfp->qf_nr) == FAIL
6292  || dict_add_string(dict, "module", qfp->qf_module) == FAIL
6293  || dict_add_string(dict, "pattern", qfp->qf_pattern) == FAIL
6294  || dict_add_string(dict, "text", qfp->qf_text) == FAIL
6295  || dict_add_string(dict, "type", buf) == FAIL
6296  || dict_add_number(dict, "valid", (long)qfp->qf_valid) == FAIL)
6297  return FAIL;
6298 
6299  return OK;
6300 }
6301 
6302 /*
6303  * Add each quickfix error to list "list" as a dictionary.
6304  * If qf_idx is -1, use the current list. Otherwise, use the specified list.
6305  */
6306  static int
6307 get_errorlist(qf_info_T *qi_arg, win_T *wp, int qf_idx, list_T *list)
6308 {
6309  qf_info_T *qi = qi_arg;
6310  qf_list_T *qfl;
6311  qfline_T *qfp;
6312  int i;
6313 
6314  if (qi == NULL)
6315  {
6316  qi = &ql_info;
6317  if (wp != NULL)
6318  {
6319  qi = GET_LOC_LIST(wp);
6320  if (qi == NULL)
6321  return FAIL;
6322  }
6323  }
6324 
6325  if (qf_idx == INVALID_QFIDX)
6326  qf_idx = qi->qf_curlist;
6327 
6328  if (qf_idx >= qi->qf_listcount)
6329  return FAIL;
6330 
6331  qfl = qf_get_list(qi, qf_idx);
6332  if (qf_list_empty(qfl))
6333  return FAIL;
6334 
6335  FOR_ALL_QFL_ITEMS(qfl, qfp, i)
6336  {
6337  if (get_qfline_items(qfp, list) == FAIL)
6338  return FAIL;
6339  }
6340 
6341  return OK;
6342 }
6343 
6344 // Flags used by getqflist()/getloclist() to determine which fields to return.
6345 enum {
6346  QF_GETLIST_NONE = 0x0,
6347  QF_GETLIST_TITLE = 0x1,
6348  QF_GETLIST_ITEMS = 0x2,
6349  QF_GETLIST_NR = 0x4,
6350  QF_GETLIST_WINID = 0x8,
6351  QF_GETLIST_CONTEXT = 0x10,
6352  QF_GETLIST_ID = 0x20,
6353  QF_GETLIST_IDX = 0x40,
6354  QF_GETLIST_SIZE = 0x80,
6355  QF_GETLIST_TICK = 0x100,
6356  QF_GETLIST_FILEWINID = 0x200,
6357  QF_GETLIST_QFBUFNR = 0x400,
6358  QF_GETLIST_ALL = 0x7FF,
6359 };
6360 
6361 /*
6362  * Parse text from 'di' and return the quickfix list items.
6363  * Existing quickfix lists are not modified.
6364  */
6365  static int
6366 qf_get_list_from_lines(dict_T *what, dictitem_T *di, dict_T *retdict)
6367 {
6368  int status = FAIL;
6369  qf_info_T *qi;
6370  char_u *errorformat = p_efm;
6371  dictitem_T *efm_di;
6372  list_T *l;
6373 
6374  // Only a List value is supported
6375  if (di->di_tv.v_type == VAR_LIST && di->di_tv.vval.v_list != NULL)
6376  {
6377  // If errorformat is supplied then use it, otherwise use the 'efm'
6378  // option setting
6379  if ((efm_di = dict_find(what, (char_u *)"efm", -1)) != NULL)
6380  {
6381  if (efm_di->di_tv.v_type != VAR_STRING ||
6382  efm_di->di_tv.vval.v_string == NULL)
6383  return FAIL;
6384  errorformat = efm_di->di_tv.vval.v_string;
6385  }
6386 
6387  l = list_alloc();
6388  if (l == NULL)
6389  return FAIL;
6390 
6391  qi = qf_alloc_stack(QFLT_INTERNAL);
6392  if (qi != NULL)
6393  {
6394  if (qf_init_ext(qi, 0, NULL, NULL, &di->di_tv, errorformat,
6395  TRUE, (linenr_T)0, (linenr_T)0, NULL, NULL) > 0)
6396  {
6397  (void)get_errorlist(qi, NULL, 0, l);
6398  qf_free(&qi->qf_lists[0]);
6399  }
6400  free(qi);
6401  }
6402  dict_add_list(retdict, "items", l);
6403  status = OK;
6404  }
6405 
6406  return status;
6407 }
6408 
6409 /*
6410  * Return the quickfix/location list window identifier in the current tabpage.
6411  */
6412  static int
6413 qf_winid(qf_info_T *qi)
6414 {
6415  win_T *win;
6416 
6417  // The quickfix window can be opened even if the quickfix list is not set
6418  // using ":copen". This is not true for location lists.
6419  if (qi == NULL)
6420  return 0;
6421  win = qf_find_win(qi);
6422  if (win != NULL)
6423  return win->w_id;
6424  return 0;
6425 }
6426 
6427 /*
6428  * Returns the number of the buffer displayed in the quickfix/location list
6429  * window. If there is no buffer associated with the list, then returns 0.
6430  */
6431  static int
6432 qf_getprop_qfbufnr(qf_info_T *qi, dict_T *retdict)
6433 {
6434  return dict_add_number(retdict, "qfbufnr",
6435  (qi == NULL) ? 0 : qi->qf_bufnr);
6436 }
6437 
6438 /*
6439  * Convert the keys in 'what' to quickfix list property flags.
6440  */
6441  static int
6442 qf_getprop_keys2flags(dict_T *what, int loclist)
6443 {
6444  int flags = QF_GETLIST_NONE;
6445 
6446  if (dict_find(what, (char_u *)"all", -1) != NULL)
6447  {
6448  flags |= QF_GETLIST_ALL;
6449  if (!loclist)
6450  // File window ID is applicable only to location list windows
6451  flags &= ~ QF_GETLIST_FILEWINID;
6452  }
6453 
6454  if (dict_find(what, (char_u *)"title", -1) != NULL)
6455  flags |= QF_GETLIST_TITLE;
6456 
6457  if (dict_find(what, (char_u *)"nr", -1) != NULL)
6458  flags |= QF_GETLIST_NR;
6459 
6460  if (dict_find(what, (char_u *)"winid", -1) != NULL)
6461  flags |= QF_GETLIST_WINID;
6462 
6463  if (dict_find(what, (char_u *)"context", -1) != NULL)
6464  flags |= QF_GETLIST_CONTEXT;
6465 
6466  if (dict_find(what, (char_u *)"id", -1) != NULL)
6467  flags |= QF_GETLIST_ID;
6468 
6469  if (dict_find(what, (char_u *)"items", -1) != NULL)
6470  flags |= QF_GETLIST_ITEMS;
6471 
6472  if (dict_find(what, (char_u *)"idx", -1) != NULL)
6473  flags |= QF_GETLIST_IDX;
6474 
6475  if (dict_find(what, (char_u *)"size", -1) != NULL)
6476  flags |= QF_GETLIST_SIZE;
6477 
6478  if (dict_find(what, (char_u *)"changedtick", -1) != NULL)
6479  flags |= QF_GETLIST_TICK;
6480 
6481  if (loclist && dict_find(what, (char_u *)"filewinid", -1) != NULL)
6482  flags |= QF_GETLIST_FILEWINID;
6483 
6484  if (dict_find(what, (char_u *)"qfbufnr", -1) != NULL)
6485  flags |= QF_GETLIST_QFBUFNR;
6486 
6487  return flags;
6488 }
6489 
6490 /*
6491  * Return the quickfix list index based on 'nr' or 'id' in 'what'.
6492  * If 'nr' and 'id' are not present in 'what' then return the current
6493  * quickfix list index.
6494  * If 'nr' is zero then return the current quickfix list index.
6495  * If 'nr' is '$' then return the last quickfix list index.
6496  * If 'id' is present then return the index of the quickfix list with that id.
6497  * If 'id' is zero then return the quickfix list index specified by 'nr'.
6498  * Return -1, if quickfix list is not present or if the stack is empty.
6499  */
6500  static int
6501 qf_getprop_qfidx(qf_info_T *qi, dict_T *what)
6502 {
6503  int qf_idx;
6504  dictitem_T *di;
6505 
6506  qf_idx = qi->qf_curlist; // default is the current list
6507  if ((di = dict_find(what, (char_u *)"nr", -1)) != NULL)
6508  {
6509  // Use the specified quickfix/location list
6510  if (di->di_tv.v_type == VAR_NUMBER)
6511  {
6512  // for zero use the current list
6513  if (di->di_tv.vval.v_number != 0)
6514  {
6515  qf_idx = di->di_tv.vval.v_number - 1;
6516  if (qf_idx < 0 || qf_idx >= qi->qf_listcount)
6517  qf_idx = INVALID_QFIDX;
6518  }
6519  }
6520  else if (di->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING
6521  && di->di_tv.vval.v_string != NULL
6522  && STRCMP(di->di_tv.vval.v_string, "$") == 0)
6523  // Get the last quickfix list number
6524  qf_idx = qi->qf_listcount - 1;
6525  else
6526  qf_idx = INVALID_QFIDX;
6527  }
6528 
6529  if ((di = dict_find(what, (char_u *)"id", -1)) != NULL)
6530  {
6531  // Look for a list with the specified id
6532  if (di->di_tv.v_type == VAR_NUMBER)
6533  {
6534  // For zero, use the current list or the list specified by 'nr'
6535  if (di->di_tv.vval.v_number != 0)
6536  qf_idx = qf_id2nr(qi, di->di_tv.vval.v_number);
6537  }
6538  else
6539  qf_idx = INVALID_QFIDX;
6540  }
6541 
6542  return qf_idx;
6543 }
6544 
6545 /*
6546  * Return default values for quickfix list properties in retdict.
6547  */
6548  static int
6549 qf_getprop_defaults(qf_info_T *qi, int flags, int locstack, dict_T *retdict)
6550 {
6551  int status = OK;
6552 
6553  if (flags & QF_GETLIST_TITLE)
6554  status = dict_add_string(retdict, "title", (char_u *)"");
6555  if ((status == OK) && (flags & QF_GETLIST_ITEMS))
6556  {
6557  list_T *l = list_alloc();
6558  if (l != NULL)
6559  status = dict_add_list(retdict, "items", l);
6560  else
6561  status = FAIL;
6562  }
6563  if ((status == OK) && (flags & QF_GETLIST_NR))
6564  status = dict_add_number(retdict, "nr", 0);
6565  if ((status == OK) && (flags & QF_GETLIST_WINID))
6566  status = dict_add_number(retdict, "winid", qf_winid(qi));
6567  if ((status == OK) && (flags & QF_GETLIST_CONTEXT))
6568  status = dict_add_string(retdict, "context", (char_u *)"");
6569  if ((status == OK) && (flags & QF_GETLIST_ID))
6570  status = dict_add_number(retdict, "id", 0);
6571  if ((status == OK) && (flags & QF_GETLIST_IDX))
6572  status = dict_add_number(retdict, "idx", 0);
6573  if ((status == OK) && (flags & QF_GETLIST_SIZE))
6574  status = dict_add_number(retdict, "size", 0);
6575  if ((status == OK) && (flags & QF_GETLIST_TICK))
6576  status = dict_add_number(retdict, "changedtick", 0);
6577  if ((status == OK) && locstack && (flags & QF_GETLIST_FILEWINID))
6578  status = dict_add_number(retdict, "filewinid", 0);
6579  if ((status == OK) && (flags & QF_GETLIST_QFBUFNR))
6580  status = qf_getprop_qfbufnr(qi, retdict);
6581 
6582  return status;
6583 }
6584 
6585 /*
6586  * Return the quickfix list title as 'title' in retdict
6587  */
6588  static int
6589 qf_getprop_title(qf_list_T *qfl, dict_T *retdict)
6590 {
6591  return dict_add_string(retdict, "title", qfl->qf_title);
6592 }
6593 
6594 /*
6595  * Returns the identifier of the window used to display files from a location
6596  * list. If there is no associated window, then returns 0. Useful only when
6597  * called from a location list window.
6598  */
6599  static int
6600 qf_getprop_filewinid(win_T *wp, qf_info_T *qi, dict_T *retdict)
6601 {
6602  int winid = 0;
6603 
6604  if (wp != NULL && IS_LL_WINDOW(wp))
6605  {
6606  win_T *ll_wp = qf_find_win_with_loclist(qi);
6607  if (ll_wp != NULL)
6608  winid = ll_wp->w_id;
6609  }
6610 
6611  return dict_add_number(retdict, "filewinid", winid);
6612 }
6613 
6614 /*
6615  * Return the quickfix list items/entries as 'items' in retdict
6616  */
6617  static int
6618 qf_getprop_items(qf_info_T *qi, int qf_idx, dict_T *retdict)
6619 {
6620  int status = OK;
6621  list_T *l = list_alloc();
6622  if (l != NULL)
6623  {
6624  (void)get_errorlist(qi, NULL, qf_idx, l);
6625  dict_add_list(retdict, "items", l);
6626  }
6627  else
6628  status = FAIL;
6629 
6630  return status;
6631 }
6632 
6633 /*
6634  * Return the quickfix list context (if any) as 'context' in retdict.
6635  */
6636  static int
6637 qf_getprop_ctx(qf_list_T *qfl, dict_T *retdict)
6638 {
6639  int status;
6640  dictitem_T *di;
6641 
6642  if (qfl->qf_ctx != NULL)
6643  {
6644  di = dictitem_alloc((char_u *)"context");
6645  if (di != NULL)
6646  {
6647  copy_tv(qfl->qf_ctx, &di->di_tv);
6648  status = dict_add(retdict, di);
6649  if (status == FAIL)
6650  dictitem_free(di);
6651  }
6652  else
6653  status = FAIL;
6654  }
6655  else
6656  status = dict_add_string(retdict, "context", (char_u *)"");
6657 
6658  return status;
6659 }
6660 
6661 /*
6662  * Return the current quickfix list index as 'idx' in retdict
6663  */
6664  static int
6665 qf_getprop_idx(qf_list_T *qfl, dict_T *retdict)
6666 {
6667  int curidx = qfl->qf_index;
6668  if (qf_list_empty(qfl))
6669  // For empty lists, current index is set to 0
6670  curidx = 0;
6671  return dict_add_number(retdict, "idx", curidx);
6672 }
6673 
6674 /*
6675  * Return quickfix/location list details (title) as a
6676  * dictionary. 'what' contains the details to return. If 'list_idx' is -1,
6677  * then current list is used. Otherwise the specified list is used.
6678  */
6679  static int
6680 qf_get_properties(win_T *wp, dict_T *what, dict_T *retdict)
6681 {
6682  qf_info_T *qi = &ql_info;
6683  qf_list_T *qfl;
6684  int status = OK;
6685  int qf_idx = INVALID_QFIDX;
6686  dictitem_T *di;
6687  int flags = QF_GETLIST_NONE;
6688 
6689  if ((di = dict_find(what, (char_u *)"lines", -1)) != NULL)
6690  return qf_get_list_from_lines(what, di, retdict);
6691 
6692  if (wp != NULL)
6693  qi = GET_LOC_LIST(wp);
6694 
6695  flags = qf_getprop_keys2flags(what, (wp != NULL));
6696 
6697  if (!qf_stack_empty(qi))
6698  qf_idx = qf_getprop_qfidx(qi, what);
6699 
6700  // List is not present or is empty
6701  if (qf_stack_empty(qi) || qf_idx == INVALID_QFIDX)
6702  return qf_getprop_defaults(qi, flags, wp != NULL, retdict);
6703 
6704  qfl = qf_get_list(qi, qf_idx);
6705 
6706  if (flags & QF_GETLIST_TITLE)
6707  status = qf_getprop_title(qfl, retdict);
6708  if ((status == OK) && (flags & QF_GETLIST_NR))
6709  status = dict_add_number(retdict, "nr", qf_idx + 1);
6710  if ((status == OK) && (flags & QF_GETLIST_WINID))
6711  status = dict_add_number(retdict, "winid", qf_winid(qi));
6712  if ((status == OK) && (flags & QF_GETLIST_ITEMS))
6713  status = qf_getprop_items(qi, qf_idx, retdict);
6714  if ((status == OK) && (flags & QF_GETLIST_CONTEXT))
6715  status = qf_getprop_ctx(qfl, retdict);
6716  if ((status == OK) && (flags & QF_GETLIST_ID))
6717  status = dict_add_number(retdict, "id", qfl->qf_id);
6718  if ((status == OK) && (flags & QF_GETLIST_IDX))
6719  status = qf_getprop_idx(qfl, retdict);
6720  if ((status == OK) && (flags & QF_GETLIST_SIZE))
6721  status = dict_add_number(retdict, "size", qfl->qf_count);
6722  if ((status == OK) && (flags & QF_GETLIST_TICK))
6723  status = dict_add_number(retdict, "changedtick", qfl->qf_changedtick);
6724  if ((status == OK) && (wp != NULL) && (flags & QF_GETLIST_FILEWINID))
6725  status = qf_getprop_filewinid(wp, qi, retdict);
6726  if ((status == OK) && (flags & QF_GETLIST_QFBUFNR))
6727  status = qf_getprop_qfbufnr(qi, retdict);
6728 
6729  return status;
6730 }
6731 
6732 /*
6733  * Add a new quickfix entry to list at 'qf_idx' in the stack 'qi' from the
6734  * items in the dict 'd'. If it is a valid error entry, then set 'valid_entry'
6735  * to TRUE.
6736  */
6737  static int
6738 qf_add_entry_from_dict(
6739  qf_list_T *qfl,
6740  dict_T *d,
6741  int first_entry,
6742  int *valid_entry)
6743 {
6744  static int did_bufnr_emsg;
6745  char_u *filename, *module, *pattern, *text, *type;
6746  int bufnum, valid, status, col, vcol, nr;
6747  long lnum;
6748 
6749  if (first_entry)
6750  did_bufnr_emsg = FALSE;
6751 
6752  filename = dict_get_string(d, (char_u *)"filename", TRUE);
6753  module = dict_get_string(d, (char_u *)"module", TRUE);
6754  bufnum = (int)dict_get_number(d, (char_u *)"bufnr");
6755  lnum = (int)dict_get_number(d, (char_u *)"lnum");
6756  col = (int)dict_get_number(d, (char_u *)"col");
6757  vcol = (int)dict_get_number(d, (char_u *)"vcol");
6758  nr = (int)dict_get_number(d, (char_u *)"nr");
6759  type = dict_get_string(d, (char_u *)"type", TRUE);
6760  pattern = dict_get_string(d, (char_u *)"pattern", TRUE);
6761  text = dict_get_string(d, (char_u *)"text", TRUE);
6762  if (text == NULL)
6763  text = vim_strsave((char_u *)"");
6764 
6765  valid = TRUE;
6766  if ((filename == NULL && bufnum == 0) || (lnum == 0 && pattern == NULL))
6767  valid = FALSE;
6768 
6769  // Mark entries with non-existing buffer number as not valid. Give the
6770  // error message only once.
6771  if (bufnum != 0 && (buflist_findnr(bufnum) == NULL))
6772  {
6773  if (!did_bufnr_emsg)
6774  {
6775  did_bufnr_emsg = TRUE;
6776  semsg(_("E92: Buffer %d not found"), bufnum);
6777  }
6778  valid = FALSE;
6779  bufnum = 0;
6780  }
6781 
6782  // If the 'valid' field is present it overrules the detected value.
6783  if ((dict_find(d, (char_u *)"valid", -1)) != NULL)
6784  valid = (int)dict_get_number(d, (char_u *)"valid");
6785 
6786  status = qf_add_entry(qfl,
6787  NULL, // dir
6788  filename,
6789  module,
6790  bufnum,
6791  text,
6792  lnum,
6793  col,
6794  vcol, // vis_col
6795  pattern, // search pattern
6796  nr,
6797  type == NULL ? NUL : *type,
6798  valid);
6799 
6800  vim_free(filename);
6801  vim_free(module);
6802  vim_free(pattern);
6803  vim_free(text);
6804  vim_free(type);
6805 
6806  if (valid)
6807  *valid_entry = TRUE;
6808 
6809  return status;
6810 }
6811 
6812 /*
6813  * Add list of entries to quickfix/location list. Each list entry is
6814  * a dictionary with item information.
6815  */
6816  static int
6817 qf_add_entries(
6818  qf_info_T *qi,
6819  int qf_idx,
6820  list_T *list,
6821  char_u *title,
6822  int action)
6823 {
6824  qf_list_T *qfl = qf_get_list(qi, qf_idx);
6825  listitem_T *li;
6826  dict_T *d;
6827  qfline_T *old_last = NULL;
6828  int retval = OK;
6829  int valid_entry = FALSE;
6830 
6831  if (action == ' ' || qf_idx == qi->qf_listcount)
6832  {
6833  // make place for a new list
6834  qf_new_list(qi, title);
6835  qf_idx = qi->qf_curlist;
6836  qfl = qf_get_list(qi, qf_idx);
6837  }
6838  else if (action == 'a' && !qf_list_empty(qfl))
6839  // Adding to existing list, use last entry.
6840  old_last = qfl->qf_last;
6841  else if (action == 'r')
6842  {
6843  qf_free_items(qfl);
6844  qf_store_title(qfl, title);
6845  }
6846 
6847  for (li = list->lv_first; li != NULL; li = li->li_next)
6848  {
6849  if (li->li_tv.v_type != VAR_DICT)
6850  continue; // Skip non-dict items
6851 
6852  d = li->li_tv.vval.v_dict;
6853  if (d == NULL)
6854  continue;
6855 
6856  retval = qf_add_entry_from_dict(qfl, d, li == list->lv_first,
6857  &valid_entry);
6858  if (retval == QF_FAIL)
6859  break;
6860  }
6861 
6862  // Check if any valid error entries are added to the list.
6863  if (valid_entry)
6864  qfl->qf_nonevalid = FALSE;
6865  else if (qfl->qf_index == 0)
6866  // no valid entry
6867  qfl->qf_nonevalid = TRUE;
6868 
6869  // If not appending to the list, set the current error to the first entry
6870  if (action != 'a')
6871  qfl->qf_ptr = qfl->qf_start;
6872 
6873  // Update the current error index if not appending to the list or if the
6874  // list was empty before and it is not empty now.
6875  if ((action != 'a' || qfl->qf_index == 0) && !qf_list_empty(qfl))
6876  qfl->qf_index = 1;
6877 
6878  // Don't update the cursor in quickfix window when appending entries
6879  qf_update_buffer(qi, old_last);
6880 
6881  return retval;
6882 }
6883 
6884 /*
6885  * Get the quickfix list index from 'nr' or 'id'
6886  */
6887  static int
6888 qf_setprop_get_qfidx(
6889  qf_info_T *qi,
6890  dict_T *what,
6891  int action,
6892  int *newlist)
6893 {
6894  dictitem_T *di;
6895  int qf_idx = qi->qf_curlist; // default is the current list
6896 
6897  if ((di = dict_find(what, (char_u *)"nr", -1)) != NULL)
6898  {
6899  // Use the specified quickfix/location list
6900  if (di->di_tv.v_type == VAR_NUMBER)
6901  {
6902  // for zero use the current list
6903  if (di->di_tv.vval.v_number != 0)
6904  qf_idx = di->di_tv.vval.v_number - 1;
6905 
6906  if ((action == ' ' || action == 'a') && qf_idx == qi->qf_listcount)
6907  {
6908  // When creating a new list, accept qf_idx pointing to the next
6909  // non-available list and add the new list at the end of the
6910  // stack.
6911  *newlist = TRUE;
6912  qf_idx = qf_stack_empty(qi) ? 0 : qi->qf_listcount - 1;
6913  }
6914  else if (qf_idx < 0 || qf_idx >= qi->qf_listcount)
6915  return INVALID_QFIDX;
6916  else if (action != ' ')
6917  *newlist = FALSE; // use the specified list
6918  }
6919  else if (di->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING
6920  && di->di_tv.vval.v_string != NULL
6921  && STRCMP(di->di_tv.vval.v_string, "$") == 0)
6922  {
6923  if (!qf_stack_empty(qi))
6924  qf_idx = qi->qf_listcount - 1;
6925  else if (*newlist)
6926  qf_idx = 0;
6927  else
6928  return INVALID_QFIDX;
6929  }
6930  else
6931  return INVALID_QFIDX;
6932  }
6933 
6934  if (!*newlist && (di = dict_find(what, (char_u *)"id", -1)) != NULL)
6935  {
6936  // Use the quickfix/location list with the specified id
6937  if (di->di_tv.v_type != VAR_NUMBER)
6938  return INVALID_QFIDX;
6939 
6940  return qf_id2nr(qi, di->di_tv.vval.v_number);
6941  }
6942 
6943  return qf_idx;
6944 }
6945 
6946 /*
6947  * Set the quickfix list title.
6948  */
6949  static int
6950 qf_setprop_title(qf_info_T *qi, int qf_idx, dict_T *what, dictitem_T *di)
6951 {
6952  qf_list_T *qfl = qf_get_list(qi, qf_idx);
6953 
6954  if (di->di_tv.v_type != VAR_STRING)
6955  return FAIL;
6956 
6957  vim_free(qfl->qf_title);
6958  qfl->qf_title = dict_get_string(what, (char_u *)"title", TRUE);
6959  if (qf_idx == qi->qf_curlist)
6960  qf_update_win_titlevar(qi);
6961 
6962  return OK;
6963 }
6964 
6965 /*
6966  * Set quickfix list items/entries.
6967  */
6968  static int
6969 qf_setprop_items(qf_info_T *qi, int qf_idx, dictitem_T *di, int action)
6970 {
6971  int retval = FAIL;
6972  char_u *title_save;
6973 
6974  if (di->di_tv.v_type != VAR_LIST)
6975  return FAIL;
6976 
6977  title_save = vim_strsave(qi->qf_lists[qf_idx].qf_title);
6978  retval = qf_add_entries(qi, qf_idx, di->di_tv.vval.v_list,
6979  title_save, action == ' ' ? 'a' : action);
6980  vim_free(title_save);
6981 
6982  return retval;
6983 }
6984 
6985 /*
6986  * Set quickfix list items/entries from a list of lines.
6987  */
6988  static int
6989 qf_setprop_items_from_lines(
6990  qf_info_T *qi,
6991  int qf_idx,
6992  dict_T *what,
6993  dictitem_T *di,
6994  int action)
6995 {
6996  char_u *errorformat = p_efm;
6997  dictitem_T *efm_di;
6998  int retval = FAIL;
6999 
7000  // Use the user supplied errorformat settings (if present)
7001  if ((efm_di = dict_find(what, (char_u *)"efm", -1)) != NULL)
7002  {
7003  if (efm_di->di_tv.v_type != VAR_STRING ||
7004  efm_di->di_tv.vval.v_string == NULL)
7005  return FAIL;
7006  errorformat = efm_di->di_tv.vval.v_string;
7007  }
7008 
7009  // Only a List value is supported
7010  if (di->di_tv.v_type != VAR_LIST || di->di_tv.vval.v_list == NULL)
7011  return FAIL;
7012 
7013  if (action == 'r')
7014  qf_free_items(&qi->qf_lists[qf_idx]);
7015  if (qf_init_ext(qi, qf_idx, NULL, NULL, &di->di_tv, errorformat,
7016  FALSE, (linenr_T)0, (linenr_T)0, NULL, NULL) > 0)
7017  retval = OK;
7018 
7019  return retval;
7020 }
7021 
7022 /*
7023  * Set quickfix list context.
7024  */
7025  static int
7026 qf_setprop_context(qf_list_T *qfl, dictitem_T *di)
7027 {
7028  typval_T *ctx;
7029 
7030  free_tv(qfl->qf_ctx);
7031  ctx = alloc_tv();
7032  if (ctx != NULL)
7033  copy_tv(&di->di_tv, ctx);
7034  qfl->qf_ctx = ctx;
7035 
7036  return OK;
7037 }
7038 
7039 /*
7040  * Set the current index in the specified quickfix list
7041  */
7042  static int
7043 qf_setprop_curidx(qf_info_T *qi, qf_list_T *qfl, dictitem_T *di)
7044 {
7045  int denote = FALSE;
7046  int newidx;
7047  int old_qfidx;
7048  qfline_T *qf_ptr;
7049 
7050  // If the specified index is '$', then use the last entry
7051  if (di->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING
7052  && di->di_tv.vval.v_string != NULL
7053  && STRCMP(di->di_tv.vval.v_string, "$") == 0)
7054  newidx = qfl->qf_count;
7055  else
7056  {
7057  // Otherwise use the specified index
7058  newidx = tv_get_number_chk(&di->di_tv, &denote);
7059  if (denote)
7060  return FAIL;
7061  }
7062 
7063  if (newidx < 1) // sanity check
7064  return FAIL;
7065  if (newidx > qfl->qf_count)
7066  newidx = qfl->qf_count;
7067 
7068  old_qfidx = qfl->qf_index;
7069  qf_ptr = get_nth_entry(qfl, newidx, &newidx);
7070  if (qf_ptr == NULL)
7071  return FAIL;
7072  qfl->qf_ptr = qf_ptr;
7073  qfl->qf_index = newidx;
7074 
7075  // If the current list is modified and it is displayed in the quickfix
7076  // window, then Update it.
7077  if (qf_get_curlist(qi)->qf_id == qfl->qf_id)
7078  qf_win_pos_update(qi, old_qfidx);
7079 
7080  return OK;
7081 }
7082 
7083 /*
7084  * Set quickfix/location list properties (title, items, context).
7085  * Also used to add items from parsing a list of lines.
7086  * Used by the setqflist() and setloclist() Vim script functions.
7087  */
7088  static int
7089 qf_set_properties(qf_info_T *qi, dict_T *what, int action, char_u *title)
7090 {
7091  dictitem_T *di;
7092  int retval = FAIL;
7093  int qf_idx;
7094  int newlist = FALSE;
7095  qf_list_T *qfl;
7096 
7097  if (action == ' ' || qf_stack_empty(qi))
7098  newlist = TRUE;
7099 
7100  qf_idx = qf_setprop_get_qfidx(qi, what, action, &newlist);
7101  if (qf_idx == INVALID_QFIDX) // List not found
7102  return FAIL;
7103 
7104  if (newlist)
7105  {
7106  qi->qf_curlist = qf_idx;
7107  qf_new_list(qi, title);
7108  qf_idx = qi->qf_curlist;
7109  }
7110 
7111  qfl = qf_get_list(qi, qf_idx);
7112  if ((di = dict_find(what, (char_u *)"title", -1)) != NULL)
7113  retval = qf_setprop_title(qi, qf_idx, what, di);
7114  if ((di = dict_find(what, (char_u *)"items", -1)) != NULL)
7115  retval = qf_setprop_items(qi, qf_idx, di, action);
7116  if ((di = dict_find(what, (char_u *)"lines", -1)) != NULL)
7117  retval = qf_setprop_items_from_lines(qi, qf_idx, what, di, action);
7118  if ((di = dict_find(what, (char_u *)"context", -1)) != NULL)
7119  retval = qf_setprop_context(qfl, di);
7120  if ((di = dict_find(what, (char_u *)"idx", -1)) != NULL)
7121  retval = qf_setprop_curidx(qi, qfl, di);
7122 
7123  if (retval == OK)
7124  qf_list_changed(qfl);
7125 
7126  return retval;
7127 }
7128 
7129 /*
7130  * Free the entire quickfix/location list stack.
7131  * If the quickfix/location list window is open, then clear it.
7132  */
7133  static void
7134 qf_free_stack(win_T *wp, qf_info_T *qi)
7135 {
7136  win_T *qfwin = qf_find_win(qi);
7137  win_T *llwin = NULL;
7138 
7139  if (qfwin != NULL)
7140  {
7141  // If the quickfix/location list window is open, then clear it
7142  if (qi->qf_curlist < qi->qf_listcount)
7143  qf_free(qf_get_curlist(qi));
7144  qf_update_buffer(qi, NULL);
7145  }
7146 
7147  if (wp != NULL && IS_LL_WINDOW(wp))
7148  {
7149  // If in the location list window, then use the non-location list
7150  // window with this location list (if present)
7151  llwin = qf_find_win_with_loclist(qi);
7152  if (llwin != NULL)
7153  wp = llwin;
7154  }
7155 
7156  qf_free_all(wp);
7157  if (wp == NULL)
7158  {
7159  // quickfix list
7160  qi->qf_curlist = 0;
7161  qi->qf_listcount = 0;
7162  }
7163  else if (qfwin != NULL)
7164  {
7165  // If the location list window is open, then create a new empty
7166  // location list
7167  qf_info_T *new_ll = qf_alloc_stack(QFLT_LOCATION);
7168 
7169  if (new_ll != NULL)
7170  {
7171  new_ll->qf_bufnr = qfwin->w_buffer->b_fnum;
7172 
7173  // first free the list reference in the location list window
7174  ll_free_all(&qfwin->w_llist_ref);
7175 
7176  qfwin->w_llist_ref = new_ll;
7177  if (wp != qfwin)
7178  win_set_loclist(wp, new_ll);
7179  }
7180  }
7181 }
7182 
7183 /*
7184  * Populate the quickfix list with the items supplied in the list
7185  * of dictionaries. "title" will be copied to w:quickfix_title.
7186  * "action" is 'a' for add, 'r' for replace. Otherwise create a new list.
7187  */
7188  int
7189 set_errorlist(
7190  win_T *wp,
7191  list_T *list,
7192  int action,
7193  char_u *title,
7194  dict_T *what)
7195 {
7196  qf_info_T *qi = &ql_info;
7197  int retval = OK;
7198 
7199  if (wp != NULL)
7200  {
7201  qi = ll_get_or_alloc_list(wp);
7202  if (qi == NULL)
7203  return FAIL;
7204  }
7205 
7206  if (action == 'f')
7207  {
7208  // Free the entire quickfix or location list stack
7209  qf_free_stack(wp, qi);
7210  return OK;
7211  }
7212 
7213  incr_quickfix_busy();
7214 
7215  if (what != NULL)
7216  retval = qf_set_properties(qi, what, action, title);
7217  else
7218  {
7219  retval = qf_add_entries(qi, qi->qf_curlist, list, title, action);
7220  if (retval == OK)
7221  qf_list_changed(qf_get_curlist(qi));
7222  }
7223 
7224  decr_quickfix_busy();
7225 
7226  return retval;
7227 }
7228 
7229 /*
7230  * Mark the context as in use for all the lists in a quickfix stack.
7231  */
7232  static int
7233 mark_quickfix_ctx(qf_info_T *qi, int copyID)
7234 {
7235  int i;
7236  int abort = FALSE;
7237  typval_T *ctx;
7238 
7239  for (i = 0; i < LISTCOUNT && !abort; ++i)
7240  {
7241  ctx = qi->qf_lists[i].qf_ctx;
7242  if (ctx != NULL && ctx->v_type != VAR_NUMBER
7243  && ctx->v_type != VAR_STRING && ctx->v_type != VAR_FLOAT)
7244  abort = set_ref_in_item(ctx, copyID, NULL, NULL);
7245  }
7246 
7247  return abort;
7248 }
7249 
7250 /*
7251  * Mark the context of the quickfix list and the location lists (if present) as
7252  * "in use". So that garbage collection doesn't free the context.
7253  */
7254  int
7255 set_ref_in_quickfix(int copyID)
7256 {
7257  int abort = FALSE;
7258  tabpage_T *tp;
7259  win_T *win;
7260 
7261  abort = mark_quickfix_ctx(&ql_info, copyID);
7262  if (abort)
7263  return abort;
7264 
7265  FOR_ALL_TAB_WINDOWS(tp, win)
7266  {
7267  if (win->w_llist != NULL)
7268  {
7269  abort = mark_quickfix_ctx(win->w_llist, copyID);
7270  if (abort)
7271  return abort;
7272  }
7273  if (IS_LL_WINDOW(win) && (win->w_llist_ref->qf_refcount == 1))
7274  {
7275  // In a location list window and none of the other windows is
7276  // referring to this location list. Mark the location list
7277  // context as still in use.
7278  abort = mark_quickfix_ctx(win->w_llist_ref, copyID);
7279  if (abort)
7280  return abort;
7281  }
7282  }
7283 
7284  return abort;
7285 }
7286 #endif
7287 
7288 /*
7289  * Return the autocmd name for the :cbuffer Ex commands
7290  */
7291  static char_u *
7292 cbuffer_get_auname(cmdidx_T cmdidx)
7293 {
7294  switch (cmdidx)
7295  {
7296  case CMD_cbuffer: return (char_u *)"cbuffer";
7297  case CMD_cgetbuffer: return (char_u *)"cgetbuffer";
7298  case CMD_caddbuffer: return (char_u *)"caddbuffer";
7299  case CMD_lbuffer: return (char_u *)"lbuffer";
7300  case CMD_lgetbuffer: return (char_u *)"lgetbuffer";
7301  case CMD_laddbuffer: return (char_u *)"laddbuffer";
7302  default: return NULL;
7303  }
7304 }
7305 
7306 /*
7307  * Process and validate the arguments passed to the :cbuffer, :caddbuffer,
7308  * :cgetbuffer, :lbuffer, :laddbuffer, :lgetbuffer Ex commands.
7309  */
7310  static int
7311 cbuffer_process_args(
7312  exarg_T *eap,
7313  buf_T **bufp,
7314  linenr_T *line1,
7315  linenr_T *line2)
7316 {
7317  buf_T *buf = NULL;
7318 
7319  if (*eap->arg == NUL)
7320  buf = curbuf;
7321  else if (*skipwhite(skipdigits(eap->arg)) == NUL)
7322  buf = buflist_findnr(atoi((char *)eap->arg));
7323 
7324  if (buf == NULL)
7325  {
7326  emsg(_(e_invarg));
7327  return FAIL;
7328  }
7329 
7330  if (buf->b_ml.ml_mfp == NULL)
7331  {
7332  emsg(_("E681: Buffer is not loaded"));
7333  return FAIL;
7334  }
7335 
7336  if (eap->addr_count == 0)
7337  {
7338  eap->line1 = 1;
7339  eap->line2 = buf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
7340  }
7341 
7342  if (eap->line1 < 1 || eap->line1 > buf->b_ml.ml_line_count
7343  || eap->line2 < 1 || eap->line2 > buf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
7344  {
7345  emsg(_(e_invrange));
7346  return FAIL;
7347  }
7348 
7349  *line1 = eap->line1;
7350  *line2 = eap->line2;
7351  *bufp = buf;
7352 
7353  return OK;
7354 }
7355 
7356 /*
7357  * ":[range]cbuffer [bufnr]" command.
7358  * ":[range]caddbuffer [bufnr]" command.
7359  * ":[range]cgetbuffer [bufnr]" command.
7360  * ":[range]lbuffer [bufnr]" command.
7361  * ":[range]laddbuffer [bufnr]" command.
7362  * ":[range]lgetbuffer [bufnr]" command.
7363  */
7364  void
7365 ex_cbuffer(exarg_T *eap)
7366 {
7367  buf_T *buf = NULL;
7368  qf_info_T *qi;
7369  char_u *au_name = NULL;
7370  int res;
7371  int_u save_qfid;
7372  win_T *wp = NULL;
7373  char_u *qf_title;
7374  linenr_T line1;
7375  linenr_T line2;
7376 
7377  au_name = cbuffer_get_auname(eap->cmdidx);
7378  if (au_name != NULL && apply_autocmds(EVENT_QUICKFIXCMDPRE, au_name,
7379  curbuf->b_fname, TRUE, curbuf))
7380  {
7381 #ifdef FEAT_EVAL
7382  if (aborting())
7383  return;
7384 #endif
7385  }
7386 
7387  // Must come after autocommands.
7388  qi = qf_cmd_get_or_alloc_stack(eap, &wp);
7389  if (qi == NULL)
7390  return;
7391 
7392  if (cbuffer_process_args(eap, &buf, &line1, &line2) == FAIL)
7393  return;
7394 
7395  qf_title = qf_cmdtitle(*eap->cmdlinep);
7396 
7397  if (buf->b_sfname)
7398  {
7399  vim_snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE, "%s (%s)",
7400  (char *)qf_title, (char *)buf->b_sfname);
7401  qf_title = IObuff;
7402  }
7403 
7404  incr_quickfix_busy();
7405 
7406  res = qf_init_ext(qi, qi->qf_curlist, NULL, buf, NULL, p_efm,
7407  (eap->cmdidx != CMD_caddbuffer
7408  && eap->cmdidx != CMD_laddbuffer),
7409  line1, line2,
7410  qf_title, NULL);
7411  if (qf_stack_empty(qi))
7412  {
7413  decr_quickfix_busy();
7414  return;
7415  }
7416  if (res >= 0)
7417  qf_list_changed(qf_get_curlist(qi));
7418 
7419  // Remember the current quickfix list identifier, so that we can
7420  // check for autocommands changing the current quickfix list.
7421  save_qfid = qf_get_curlist(qi)->qf_id;
7422  if (au_name != NULL)
7423  {
7424  buf_T *curbuf_old = curbuf;
7425 
7426  apply_autocmds(EVENT_QUICKFIXCMDPOST, au_name, curbuf->b_fname,
7427  TRUE, curbuf);
7428  if (curbuf != curbuf_old)
7429  // Autocommands changed buffer, don't jump now, "qi" may
7430  // be invalid.
7431  res = 0;
7432  }
7433  // Jump to the first error for a new list and if autocmds didn't
7434  // free the list.
7435  if (res > 0 && (eap->cmdidx == CMD_cbuffer ||
7436  eap->cmdidx == CMD_lbuffer)
7437  && qflist_valid(wp, save_qfid))
7438  // display the first error
7439  qf_jump_first(qi, save_qfid, eap->forceit);
7440 
7441  decr_quickfix_busy();
7442 }
7443 
7444 #if defined(FEAT_EVAL) || defined(PROTO)
7445 /*
7446  * Return the autocmd name for the :cexpr Ex commands.
7447  */
7448  static char_u *
7449 cexpr_get_auname(cmdidx_T cmdidx)
7450 {
7451  switch (cmdidx)
7452  {
7453  case CMD_cexpr: return (char_u *)"cexpr";
7454  case CMD_cgetexpr: return (char_u *)"cgetexpr";
7455  case CMD_caddexpr: return (char_u *)"caddexpr";
7456  case CMD_lexpr: return (char_u *)"lexpr";
7457  case CMD_lgetexpr: return (char_u *)"lgetexpr";
7458  case CMD_laddexpr: return (char_u *)"laddexpr";
7459  default: return NULL;
7460  }
7461 }
7462 
7463 /*
7464  * ":cexpr {expr}", ":cgetexpr {expr}", ":caddexpr {expr}" command.
7465  * ":lexpr {expr}", ":lgetexpr {expr}", ":laddexpr {expr}" command.
7466  */
7467  void
7468 ex_cexpr(exarg_T *eap)
7469 {
7470  typval_T *tv;
7471  qf_info_T *qi;
7472  char_u *au_name = NULL;
7473  int res;
7474  int_u save_qfid;
7475  win_T *wp = NULL;
7476 
7477  au_name = cexpr_get_auname(eap->cmdidx);
7478  if (au_name != NULL && apply_autocmds(EVENT_QUICKFIXCMDPRE, au_name,
7479  curbuf->b_fname, TRUE, curbuf))
7480  {
7481 #ifdef FEAT_EVAL
7482  if (aborting())
7483  return;
7484 #endif
7485  }
7486 
7487  qi = qf_cmd_get_or_alloc_stack(eap, &wp);
7488  if (qi == NULL)
7489  return;
7490 
7491  // Evaluate the expression. When the result is a string or a list we can
7492  // use it to fill the errorlist.
7493  tv = eval_expr(eap->arg, NULL);
7494  if (tv != NULL)
7495  {
7496  if ((tv->v_type == VAR_STRING && tv->vval.v_string != NULL)
7497  || (tv->v_type == VAR_LIST && tv->vval.v_list != NULL))
7498  {
7499  incr_quickfix_busy();
7500  res = qf_init_ext(qi, qi->qf_curlist, NULL, NULL, tv, p_efm,
7501  (eap->cmdidx != CMD_caddexpr
7502  && eap->cmdidx != CMD_laddexpr),
7503  (linenr_T)0, (linenr_T)0,
7504  qf_cmdtitle(*eap->cmdlinep), NULL);
7505  if (qf_stack_empty(qi))
7506  {
7507  decr_quickfix_busy();
7508  goto cleanup;
7509  }
7510  if (res >= 0)
7511  qf_list_changed(qf_get_curlist(qi));
7512 
7513  // Remember the current quickfix list identifier, so that we can
7514  // check for autocommands changing the current quickfix list.
7515  save_qfid = qf_get_curlist(qi)->qf_id;
7516  if (au_name != NULL)
7517  apply_autocmds(EVENT_QUICKFIXCMDPOST, au_name,
7518  curbuf->b_fname, TRUE, curbuf);
7519 
7520  // Jump to the first error for a new list and if autocmds didn't
7521  // free the list.
7522  if (res > 0 && (eap->cmdidx == CMD_cexpr
7523  || eap->cmdidx == CMD_lexpr)
7524  && qflist_valid(wp, save_qfid))
7525  // display the first error
7526  qf_jump_first(qi, save_qfid, eap->forceit);
7527  decr_quickfix_busy();
7528  }
7529  else
7530  emsg(_("E777: String or List expected"));
7531 cleanup:
7532  free_tv(tv);
7533  }
7534 }
7535 #endif
7536 
7537 /*
7538  * Get the location list for ":lhelpgrep"
7539  */
7540  static qf_info_T *
7541 hgr_get_ll(int *new_ll)
7542 {
7543  win_T *wp;
7544  qf_info_T *qi;
7545 
7546  // If the current window is a help window, then use it
7547  if (bt_help(curwin->w_buffer))
7548  wp = curwin;
7549  else
7550  // Find an existing help window
7551  wp = qf_find_help_win();
7552 
7553  if (wp == NULL) // Help window not found
7554  qi = NULL;
7555  else
7556  qi = wp->w_llist;
7557 
7558  if (qi == NULL)
7559  {
7560  // Allocate a new location list for help text matches
7561  if ((qi = qf_alloc_stack(QFLT_LOCATION)) == NULL)
7562  return NULL;
7563  *new_ll = TRUE;
7564  }
7565 
7566  return qi;
7567 }
7568 
7569 /*
7570  * Search for a pattern in a help file.
7571  */
7572  static void
7573 hgr_search_file(
7574  qf_list_T *qfl,
7575  char_u *fname,
7576  vimconv_T *p_vc,
7577  regmatch_T *p_regmatch)
7578 {
7579  FILE *fd;
7580  long lnum;
7581 
7582  fd = mch_fopen((char *)fname, "r");
7583  if (fd == NULL)
7584  return;
7585 
7586  lnum = 1;
7587  while (!vim_fgets(IObuff, IOSIZE, fd) && !got_int)
7588  {
7589  char_u *line = IObuff;
7590 
7591  // Convert a line if 'encoding' is not utf-8 and
7592  // the line contains a non-ASCII character.
7593  if (p_vc->vc_type != CONV_NONE
7594  && has_non_ascii(IObuff))
7595  {
7596  line = string_convert(p_vc, IObuff, NULL);
7597  if (line == NULL)
7598  line = IObuff;
7599  }
7600 
7601  if (vim_regexec(p_regmatch, line, (colnr_T)0))
7602  {
7603  int l = (int)STRLEN(line);
7604 
7605  // remove trailing CR, LF, spaces, etc.
7606  while (l > 0 && line[l - 1] <= ' ')
7607  line[--l] = NUL;
7608 
7609  if (qf_add_entry(qfl,
7610  NULL, // dir
7611  fname,
7612  NULL,
7613  0,
7614  line,
7615  lnum,
7616  (int)(p_regmatch->startp[0] - line)
7617  + 1, // col
7618  FALSE, // vis_col
7619  NULL, // search pattern
7620  0, // nr
7621  1, // type
7622  TRUE // valid
7623  ) == QF_FAIL)
7624  {
7625  got_int = TRUE;
7626  if (line != IObuff)
7627  vim_free(line);
7628  break;
7629  }
7630  }
7631  if (line != IObuff)
7632  vim_free(line);
7633  ++lnum;
7634  line_breakcheck();
7635  }
7636  fclose(fd);
7637 }
7638 
7639 /*
7640  * Search for a pattern in all the help files in the doc directory under
7641  * the given directory.
7642  */
7643  static void
7644 hgr_search_files_in_dir(
7645  qf_list_T *qfl,
7646  char_u *dirname,
7647  regmatch_T *p_regmatch,
7648  vimconv_T *p_vc
7649 #ifdef FEAT_MULTI_LANG
7650  , char_u *lang
7651 #endif
7652  )
7653 {
7654  int fcount;
7655  char_u **fnames;
7656  int fi;
7657 
7658  // Find all "*.txt" and "*.??x" files in the "doc" directory.
7659  add_pathsep(dirname);
7660  STRCAT(dirname, "doc/*.\\(txt\\|??x\\)");
7661  if (gen_expand_wildcards(1, &dirname, &fcount,
7662  &fnames, EW_FILE|EW_SILENT) == OK
7663  && fcount > 0)
7664  {
7665  for (fi = 0; fi < fcount && !got_int; ++fi)
7666  {
7667 #ifdef FEAT_MULTI_LANG
7668  // Skip files for a different language.
7669  if (lang != NULL
7670  && STRNICMP(lang, fnames[fi]
7671  + STRLEN(fnames[fi]) - 3, 2) != 0
7672  && !(STRNICMP(lang, "en", 2) == 0
7673  && STRNICMP("txt", fnames[fi]
7674  + STRLEN(fnames[fi]) - 3, 3) == 0))
7675  continue;
7676 #endif
7677 
7678  hgr_search_file(qfl, fnames[fi], p_vc, p_regmatch);
7679  }
7680  FreeWild(fcount, fnames);
7681  }
7682 }
7683 
7684 /*
7685  * Search for a pattern in all the help files in the 'runtimepath'
7686  * and add the matches to a quickfix list.
7687  * 'lang' is the language specifier. If supplied, then only matches in the
7688  * specified language are found.
7689  */
7690  static void
7691 hgr_search_in_rtp(qf_list_T *qfl, regmatch_T *p_regmatch, char_u *lang)
7692 {
7693  char_u *p;
7694 
7695  vimconv_T vc;
7696 
7697  // Help files are in utf-8 or latin1, convert lines when 'encoding'
7698  // differs.
7699  vc.vc_type = CONV_NONE;
7700  if (!enc_utf8)
7701  convert_setup(&vc, (char_u *)"utf-8", p_enc);
7702 
7703  // Go through all the directories in 'runtimepath'
7704  p = p_rtp;
7705  while (*p != NUL && !got_int)
7706  {
7707  copy_option_part(&p, NameBuff, MAXPATHL, ",");
7708 
7709  hgr_search_files_in_dir(qfl, NameBuff, p_regmatch, &vc
7710 #ifdef FEAT_MULTI_LANG
7711  , lang
7712 #endif
7713  );
7714  }
7715 
7716  if (vc.vc_type != CONV_NONE)
7717  convert_setup(&vc, NULL, NULL);
7718 }
7719 
7720 /*
7721  * ":helpgrep {pattern}"
7722  */
7723  void
7724 ex_helpgrep(exarg_T *eap)
7725 {
7726  regmatch_T regmatch;
7727  char_u *save_cpo;
7728  qf_info_T *qi = &ql_info;
7729  int new_qi = FALSE;
7730  char_u *au_name = NULL;
7731  char_u *lang = NULL;
7732 
7733  switch (eap->cmdidx)
7734  {
7735  case CMD_helpgrep: au_name = (char_u *)"helpgrep"; break;
7736  case CMD_lhelpgrep: au_name = (char_u *)"lhelpgrep"; break;
7737  default: break;
7738  }
7739  if (au_name != NULL && apply_autocmds(EVENT_QUICKFIXCMDPRE, au_name,
7740  curbuf->b_fname, TRUE, curbuf))
7741  {
7742 #ifdef FEAT_EVAL
7743  if (aborting())
7744  return;
7745 #endif
7746  }
7747 
7748  if (is_loclist_cmd(eap->cmdidx))
7749  {
7750  qi = hgr_get_ll(&new_qi);
7751  if (qi == NULL)
7752  return;
7753  }
7754 
7755  // Make 'cpoptions' empty, the 'l' flag should not be used here.
7756  save_cpo = p_cpo;
7757  p_cpo = empty_option;
7758 
7759  incr_quickfix_busy();
7760 
7761 #ifdef FEAT_MULTI_LANG
7762  // Check for a specified language
7763  lang = check_help_lang(eap->arg);
7764 #endif
7765  regmatch.regprog = vim_regcomp(eap->arg, RE_MAGIC + RE_STRING);
7766  regmatch.rm_ic = FALSE;
7767  if (regmatch.regprog != NULL)
7768  {
7769  qf_list_T *qfl;
7770 
7771  // create a new quickfix list
7772  qf_new_list(qi, qf_cmdtitle(*eap->cmdlinep));
7773  qfl = qf_get_curlist(qi);
7774 
7775  hgr_search_in_rtp(qfl, &regmatch, lang);
7776 
7777  vim_regfree(regmatch.regprog);
7778 
7779  qfl->qf_nonevalid = FALSE;
7780  qfl->qf_ptr = qfl->qf_start;
7781  qfl->qf_index = 1;
7782  qf_list_changed(qfl);
7783  qf_update_buffer(qi, NULL);
7784  }
7785 
7786  if (p_cpo == empty_option)
7787  p_cpo = save_cpo;
7788  else
7789  // Darn, some plugin changed the value.
7790  free_string_option(save_cpo);
7791 
7792  if (au_name != NULL)
7793  {
7794  apply_autocmds(EVENT_QUICKFIXCMDPOST, au_name,
7795  curbuf->b_fname, TRUE, curbuf);
7796  if (!new_qi && IS_LL_STACK(qi) && qf_find_buf(qi) == NULL)
7797  {
7798  // autocommands made "qi" invalid
7799  decr_quickfix_busy();
7800  return;
7801  }
7802  }
7803 
7804  // Jump to first match.
7805  if (!qf_list_empty(qf_get_curlist(qi)))
7806  qf_jump(qi, 0, 0, FALSE);
7807  else
7808  semsg(_(e_nomatch2), eap->arg);
7809 
7810  decr_quickfix_busy();
7811 
7812  if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_lhelpgrep)
7813  {
7814  // If the help window is not opened or if it already points to the
7815  // correct location list, then free the new location list.
7816  if (!bt_help(curwin->w_buffer) || curwin->w_llist == qi)
7817  {
7818  if (new_qi)
7819  ll_free_all(&qi);
7820  }
7821  else if (curwin->w_llist == NULL)
7822  curwin->w_llist = qi;
7823  }
7824 }
7825 #endif /* FEAT_QUICKFIX */
7826 
7827 #if defined(FEAT_EVAL) || defined(PROTO)
7828 # ifdef FEAT_QUICKFIX
7829  static void
7830 get_qf_loc_list(int is_qf, win_T *wp, typval_T *what_arg, typval_T *rettv)
7831 {
7832  if (what_arg->v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN)
7833  {
7834  if (rettv_list_alloc(rettv) == OK)
7835  if (is_qf || wp != NULL)
7836  (void)get_errorlist(NULL, wp, -1, rettv->vval.v_list);
7837  }
7838  else
7839  {
7840  if (rettv_dict_alloc(rettv) == OK)
7841  if (is_qf || (wp != NULL))
7842  {
7843  if (what_arg->v_type == VAR_DICT)
7844  {
7845  dict_T *d = what_arg->vval.v_dict;
7846 
7847  if (d != NULL)
7848  qf_get_properties(wp, d, rettv->vval.v_dict);
7849  }
7850  else
7851  emsg(_(e_dictreq));
7852  }
7853  }
7854 }
7855 # endif
7856 
7857 /*
7858  * "getloclist()" function
7859  */
7860  void
7861 f_getloclist(typval_T *argvars UNUSED, typval_T *rettv UNUSED)
7862 {
7863 # ifdef FEAT_QUICKFIX
7864  win_T *wp;
7865 
7866  wp = find_win_by_nr_or_id(&argvars[0]);
7867  get_qf_loc_list(FALSE, wp, &argvars[1], rettv);
7868 # endif
7869 }
7870 
7871 /*
7872  * "getqflist()" function
7873  */
7874  void
7875 f_getqflist(typval_T *argvars UNUSED, typval_T *rettv UNUSED)
7876 {
7877 # ifdef FEAT_QUICKFIX
7878  get_qf_loc_list(TRUE, NULL, &argvars[0], rettv);
7879 # endif
7880 }
7881 
7882 /*
7883  * Used by "setqflist()" and "setloclist()" functions
7884  */
7885  static void
7886 set_qf_ll_list(
7887  win_T *wp UNUSED,
7888  typval_T *list_arg UNUSED,
7889  typval_T *action_arg UNUSED,
7890  typval_T *what_arg UNUSED,
7891  typval_T *rettv)
7892 {
7893 # ifdef FEAT_QUICKFIX
7894  static char *e_invact = N_("E927: Invalid action: '%s'");
7895  char_u *act;
7896  int action = 0;
7897  static int recursive = 0;
7898 # endif
7899 
7900  rettv->vval.v_number = -1;
7901 
7902 # ifdef FEAT_QUICKFIX
7903  if (list_arg->v_type != VAR_LIST)
7904  emsg(_(e_listreq));
7905  else if (recursive != 0)
7906  emsg(_(e_au_recursive));
7907  else
7908  {
7909  list_T *l = list_arg->vval.v_list;
7910  dict_T *d = NULL;
7911  int valid_dict = TRUE;
7912 
7913  if (action_arg->v_type == VAR_STRING)
7914  {
7915  act = tv_get_string_chk(action_arg);
7916  if (act == NULL)
7917  return; // type error; errmsg already given
7918  if ((*act == 'a' || *act == 'r' || *act == ' ' || *act == 'f') &&
7919  act[1] == NUL)
7920  action = *act;
7921  else
7922  semsg(_(e_invact), act);
7923  }
7924  else if (action_arg->v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN)
7925  action = ' ';
7926  else
7927  emsg(_(e_stringreq));
7928 
7929  if (action_arg->v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN
7930  && what_arg->v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN)
7931  {
7932  if (what_arg->v_type == VAR_DICT)
7933  d = what_arg->vval.v_dict;
7934  else
7935  {
7936  emsg(_(e_dictreq));
7937  valid_dict = FALSE;
7938  }
7939  }
7940 
7941  ++recursive;
7942  if (l != NULL && action && valid_dict && set_errorlist(wp, l, action,
7943  (char_u *)(wp == NULL ? ":setqflist()" : ":setloclist()"),
7944  d) == OK)
7945  rettv->vval.v_number = 0;
7946  --recursive;
7947  }
7948 # endif
7949 }
7950 
7951 /*
7952  * "setloclist()" function
7953  */
7954  void
7955 f_setloclist(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
7956 {
7957  win_T *win;
7958 
7959  rettv->vval.v_number = -1;
7960 
7961  win = find_win_by_nr_or_id(&argvars[0]);
7962  if (win != NULL)
7963  set_qf_ll_list(win, &argvars[1], &argvars[2], &argvars[3], rettv);
7964 }
7965 
7966 /*
7967  * "setqflist()" function
7968  */
7969  void
7970 f_setqflist(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
7971 {
7972  set_qf_ll_list(NULL, &argvars[0], &argvars[1], &argvars[2], rettv);
7973 }
7974 #endif

int w_width
